reviewtext: Just An Average stay This was just an average stay, with nothing standing out. If the weather is good, I would recommend eating at the 13 Coins Restaurant which is a short walk from the Marriott, versus eating at the hotel restaurant. There is also a 7 Eleven about a block away if one needs other things. This is a typical Marriott, where they charge you for everything, including the Internet. What bothered me most was when I had to leave at 4:30am, and was waiting for my ride in the lobby, there was no staff around, and anyone could have walked into the place. It's not a bad place, but nothing stands out as being above average either.

go elsewhere The place is hugely overpriced and mis-managed.Better places to stay are the Hilton or Radisson, both of which are in the same airport area.I arrived and had to walk down endless corridors before finding out my key did not work. Finally got another room, other people's hairs in the bathtub. Gross, small, old-school and pricey.Yuk!

I Won't Go Back I stayed at the hotel 11/14/08 for 2 nights. I booked the package through Marriotts web site. The package incuded a deluxe room, free parking and a gas card. When we checked in we were told our room was not ready but they could give a handicapped room. I asked to look at the room. It was on the first floor facing the street and parking lot. I went back and said we would wait for our room. We came back 2 hours later and they gave me keys to room 199 which was 3 rooms away from the room we originally looked at, again facing the street and parking lot. I went back to the front desk and said I booked a deluxe room which was supposed to overlook the pool and be on a higher floor. I was told deluxe and standard rooms are the same. I was getting nowhere with the front desk. I went back to my 1st floor room and called the phone number on my marriott rewards card and explained the problem to them. I was told they would have a manager call me in my room. After no call I went to the managers office and talked to one of the managers and she said to me you want a deluxe room for the price you paid? I said yes that is what the package offers and I did not create the package I just bought Marriotts package. She then told me the package did not offer a deluxe room but a standard room. I told her that supposedly they are the same from what the front desk tells me. I told her that I had called the hotel directly before i booked and asked about the rooms and was told a deluxe room was a higher floor facing the pool. I then showed her my reservation confirmation which said deluxe room on it. The manager said well nobody else has complained. I told the manager that I could have stayed at the Hilton or Doubletree down the street cheaper and I will check out unless I get the room I paid for. Finally she says well your right I will get another room. I did get another room still on the first floor but facing the pool. The hotel was not very busy and we should have gotten the room we paid for which we never did. Bait and Switch at its best. I will stay at the Hilton or Doubletree down the street on my future visits to Seattle area. The room was okay very dark, small bathroom. The bed very comfortable. Old T.V. no flat screens.

Good weekend stay My wife and I stay here quite regularly when we visit Seattle to see a football game. The shuttle from the airport is always on time and operates almost 24 hours a day. The rooms are typical Marriott and always clean and functional. The restaurant is good with some very good items and others quite normal. If there is a large convention in the hotel (which occurs quite regularly on weekends) be careful where your room is(stay away from pool side). The hotel is old but has been remodeled very recently but the noise in the hallways and especially around the pool can be very annoying. Standard complaint is the charge for internet usage.

Great airport stay Lovely indoor pool area, looks like a lodge. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was clean, very comfortable and spacious, with minimal noise from outside (you could hear planes, but only if you really listened for them). The breakfast buffet was good value with great coffee (Starbucks), but the omelet chef did not have the slightest clue as to what he was doing. I got more of a scramble than an omelet, and he might have put all of three spinach leaves in the whole thing, which cooked down to nothing. I booked a cars eat free package which included parking and a $25 gas card - if they still have this deal it is worth it. Overall a very good experience.

Great Place!!!! We did a seminar here and the place was great. Beautiful indoor atrium with swimming pool, hot tub etc. Guest rooms very clean, quiet and comfortable. Beds were heavenly.Setup and support for our seminar was superb.Only negative I can think of is that their breakfast buffet was ridiculously overpriced, but otherwise the bar and restaurant was excellent.

No Free Internet? Wow, that irritates me! This hotel is amazing. I love the rooms, I love the fitness center, and I really love the pool area. It is a huge pool with two hot tubs that are actually, hot. I know this sounds odd but the hotel smells amazing. The staff was helpful and there are some restaurants in the area. One gripe, and it's a big one. The Internet. Will you please explain to me why the more expensive hotel chains charge for wireless but motels like Comfort Inn, and La Quinta, give complimentary internet? It is the number one complaint that I have against the whole Marriott chain. Although I do realize that some of the Marriott brands (Fairfield, Courtyard) offer the complimentary internet, I just believe that for $150 a night you should receive free internet! Overall, a very nice Marriott, with exceptionally clean rooms!

good business hotel stayed here one night on business.I selected this hotel simply because the workshop that I was attending was held there. Seemed expensive, at ~$250/night, so I'd shop around if I were returning to the area. The hotel is about one mile from the airport, so very convenient in that regard. A complimentary shuttle runs every 15 minutes, and this is also a plus. My room (and based on what I saw, the other standard rooms) was not very big, but was well-appointed: luxurious king bed, chest of drawers, armchair with footstool, desk with work chair, Starbucks in-room coffee. The bathroom and amenities were nice. The room was clean and reasonably quiet. I did not bring my laptop, so can't comment on the internet connection, however, there is a business center with 2 computer stations where travelers can check email, etc, no charge. There is also a kiosk especially for doing airline web check-in so you can print your boarding pass, a nice touch. The hotel has an atrium, where the pool and jacuzzis are located. It is quite nice, with trees. The fitness room was better than I encounter at most hotels. They had a selection of cardio equipment: bikes, treadmills, elliptical trainers, plus some weight machines and free weights. There is a somewhat pricey cafe in the hotel. I had breakfast and lunch there. The food and service were good. There does not seem to be any other place to eat within walking distance. The staff were nice and courteous. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to a business traveler.
Parking is a shakedown       Parking Card Readers Don't Work

Wow! This place was amazing! We booked it solely because of its proximity to the airport (a 5 minute shuttle ride) and were dazzled when we checked in. The whole place is done up to look like a lodge. Beautiful wood beams everywhere. The pool was enormous. Our room was small, but beauiful, and a terrific bargain. I'd like to stay there again, for longer this time.

Nice and Comfortable The rooms here were very comfortable. The bed was awesome; attractively made-up and super comfy. I do agree that the halls/elevator set-up is a little tricky, but asides from that small detail, I had a pleasant stay. I ate one meal in the main restaurant as well and it was quite good. It took a little while to get our food, but we were the first customers after they opened for lunch, so they probably had to turn on the stoves and stuff.
Great Airport Hotel       Desk area

Great short stay! Arrived in the middle of the night after hours of delay at airports. Staff was very welcoming, refunded us the $ we had to pay for a cab from airport since shuttle was not available at those hours. Was also given a discounted rate since we would be departing in a few hours. The rooms were very nice, wonderful beds, nice bathrooms. Service and food choices in the hotel restaurant were excellent. Didn't get a chance to use the pool, but it looked fantastic. Shuttle driver back to airport in the morning was friendly, helpful and efficient. We were recharged and ready to continue our trip after a horrible start!

Recommended. Nice Lobby. 1. Overall ImpressionsAn aging Marriott with small rooms, small bathrooms, and a nice big lobby area. In fact, the lobby with its stonework and beams is the most interesting part of the Marriott SEATAC Airport (SEA). 2. LayoutYes, this is that ancient one with ONE elevator .... 3. BedsVery pleasant and soft. 4. BathroomsUnremarkable.Tiny. 5. RestaurantsNice cold beer at the bar in the lobby. 6. Front deskAccurate, pleasant and well-trained 7. Charges (internet, parking, etc)No charges for internet access.
Nice Marriot       View of my king bed room

Good hotel, charges for internet access The Marriott Airport Seattle is a reasonable choice in the Sea-Tac area. I paid about $189 per night. The shuttle is generally quick to and from the airport and I encourage its use rather taxi service which can be very spotty in Seattle. My room was in the second floor but in the back of the hotel such that I had a very long walk no matter which way I took to the room. The interior is nice and check in was very quick.Breakfast was good in the restaurant, if not a bit pricey. Drink service in the bar was fine, no complaints. I can imagine that it must get very noisy in the lobby when the crowd is hanging out in thebar. I guess Marriott has a new program where guests are now charged for internet service. Its $9.95 at this hotel, but can be had for free at the business center near the check-in counters. There are two internet PCs and one boarding pass access PC.Personally, the ability to sit in my room and check my personal or work email is nice and I am not sure how many takers will pay extra for the access. And I am hoping not to get nickel and dimed for that.I can offer four stars as the overall quality was good.

Small but adequate rooms If you have an early morning flight to catch, this is a good choice as it is right at the airport. It has been recently renovated so the rooms are new and clean. The room service was fast and efficient and the food was good. The negatives were that our room was very small and the bathroom was the smallest I've encountered in many years. Hardly room to turn around and I'm a small person. However, the countertops were granite, which was nice. Also there is only one elevator, which seemed odd for a hotel of this size. You may self park or valet park, both for a fee. Would not recommend for an extended stay, but it is fine for a one visit.

Better than average, some noisy rooms I have stayed at this hotel a few times inthe last several months. The first stay was not the best, but the subsequent ones got better, and they have obviously taken some of the notes on the comment cards seriously.The hotel is located near SeaTac with a frequent shuttle. There is a tower, 8-9 floors high, and an atrium area that is about 3-4 floors high. Note, the tower rooms really have no view although some are advertised as having Mt. Rainier views. (Maybe before the trees grew!) Regardless of where you are, in the tower youwill be looking at the roof/ventilation or the roof/associate entrance. Avoid rooms ending in X16 and X18 as these are a bit noisy when the trucks show up. Odd numbered tower rooms will be a little noisy from the AC but frankly it wasn't as bad!The bathrooms are small, and double double rooms are a little crowded. King rooms seem bigger and have a chair and ottoman. All have been redone very recently but don't have the big flat screen TVs. The desk is pretty roomy and there is a cabinet and 2 small drawers...not the greatest storage.Rooms in the atrium area are noisier for some reason. Aside from the noise from the pool (and functions if there are any being held near the pool), it seems that the walls are thinner....last time, I actually thought someone left a cellphone in my room it was ringing so loudly.Food in the hotel is good-could be better. It is a bit pricy. The restaurant is due to be redone 1st quarter 2008. Desserts however, were tasty, and since I had some issues with my meals, they were free! Try the chocolate cake, it is VERY good! The lobby/bar are nice but the music is a lot too loud! One of the songs played has some sort of random spoken sounds...very disconcerting!Internet is part of the $9.95 wired for business package so if you don;t make calls, it's too expensive. I don't know when Marriott will get it through their brains...STOP CHARGING FOR INTERNET! There is a business center with 2 computers and an ethernet cable that you can use for free. Also, you can get free use of internet in the concierge lounge.There are only a couple other dining choices in walking distance (Dennys and 13 coins-which I think is also too expensive.) Other than that, and restaurants in other hotels, you need a car or a cab. Self parking is $16 per day, valet is $22-very high, but it's the norm for cities!Be careful in the shower...tubs can get slippery (I fell). I was able to get a rubber mat, but I also informed the GM and several other people of the situation, and that housekeeping needs to rinse carefully.The hotel is very clean. I even noticed a housekeeper vacuuming the rock wall outside of the restaurant. The staff was friendly, remembering me by name, and by my luggage-which seems to go someplace else when I come to Seattle!Seems that this is also a popular hotel with cruisers as there were a large number of folks heading off to Alaska on Vision of the Seas...maybe this is a Royal Caribbean pre-cruise hotel.Some people hate the pacific northwest design of the hotel-the lobby looks like a lodge. Frankly, I think it is appropriate for the area. There are plenty of places inthe area, but all in all this hotel is nice for flyers or anyone needing to be out inthe SeaTac area. It's about 30-45 minutes to downtown and you can hop on a bus at the airport (I also think there is a stop at the end of the hill) or drive. Also, tours can be arranged-many of which will pick up at airport area hotels.Give it a try!

Ordinary Although it is highly rated in these reviews, and you pay a premium price compared with other airport hotels, there is nothing special about this hotel other than its proximity to SEATAC. If you are thinking of staying here, pay attention to the Trip Advisor comments about the hideous views of HVAC equipment from the windows on one whole side of the hotel. Although my room was on the top floor of the building, the view looked like an industrial site, just because of all the equipment on the roof of a lower wing of the building. The room itself was spacious, the bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was functional. But during a rainstorm in the middle of the night, the ceiling leaked. The club lounge, for which I had paid extra, was about as modest as any I've ever seen. But it did have good food at breakfast. The best part of the hotel in my experience was its restaurant. The room itself was extremely ordinary, looking like a roadside restaurant on a freeway, but the food and the service were first-rate. Bottom line: I slept well here. But even though I collect Marriott points, I don't think I'd return to this hotel.

Awesome for early AM flight Wow! what a suprise. We stayed at the this property for one night (July 3) with my wife and two children (4 and 18 months). Check in was faster than I have ever experienced and had a newly renovated room on the 7th floor overlooking the airport (the parking garage actually). Room was larger than I expected (two double beds) and had plenty of room for the porta crib. The bellmen were very helpful with bags and even set the crib up for us. My Son and I went swimming and a had a great time. The beds were super comfortable and we slept well (very quiet). The hotel was not busy (very slow) but I don't think that would change if it was busy.Check out was very efficient. The shuttle comes every 15 minutes, and is less than five minutes from the airport.We will definatly stay here again if we have an early AM flight.Great job on this property Marriott. I'm a big fan.

Good Stay Spent two nights there in Jun. The hotel is very close to the airport and the shuttle runs about every 15 mins and is free. The room was clean with a very comfortable bed and linens. Although somewhat small it was very functional. The lobby seemed very noisy although the room was very quiet. I didn't eat in the restaurant but room service was good and quick. It seemed to take forever to get to my room, they seem to be very spread out.

Great Staff We stayed overnight the last week of May, flying out in the morning. We had no problem leaving our car except, when we checked in they asked for our AAA card. Evidently the rate we got for park, sleep and fly was for AAA members only. This was not an option or even mentioned on their web reservation form. The front desk quickly recognized this as their error and we were off to our super comfy room. We had a great dinner in the restaurant. Super efficient drop off on departure day and much quicker pick up then some other hotels we have used in the past. One tiny little thing on our way back was the guy who picked us up stopped to pick up his take out dinner before he dropped us back at the hotel. That was kind of weird!! Overall the experience was good and the hotel was great.

fine choice for seatac The lobby is attractive but a bit small and noisy. The room itself seemed newly redecorated/remodeled. It was not too big but had a very comfortable king bed with lovely duvet and many pillows. The bathroom was luxury level with granite countertops, attractive large framed mirror. There is a free computer off the lobby for printing boarding passes. The Hilton is a block away so you can easily walk over for their restaurant. It is a large steak house type place but there are other choices as well. As noted here, the parking is a ripoff. We dropped off our rental car early to avoid the overnight charge.

Great value, looking for a nice hotel. not expensive, nice service, great looking lodge, but old / outdated rooms. this is the place for you. Try the breakfast. Great place to stay if you are coming in the night before and going to an alaska cruise out of seattle. Take the car service to the terminal. Great service and well priced.

Very nice but expensive parking This hotel is very nicely renovated with a modern bar and beautiful indoor pool in the treed atrium. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are immaculately clean and the beds are extremely comfortable due to the nice linens and down pillows. My only concern was the expensive parking. It will run you $16 per day which I expect in L.A., but not Seattle. Other than that we had a wonderful stay and good food in the restaurant.

Very Happy With My Stay This property has not gotten rave reviews, but I wanted to sleep on aRevive bed so gave them a try. We arrived after 10 pm very tired and were greeted by Eric at the front desk and he found us the 2 rooms wewanted and even took us up. We came down and had dinner in the bar, ordering from the dining room menu. We had very good food. I'll return to stay a night just for the horseradish crusted salmon. We faced the very pretty atrium and didn't hear noise until 9 am. The reception area downstairs is comfy and has a warm feeling. Not like the # 1 ranked hotel I stayed in over Christmas. That was a cold uninviting space. I don't know if the one elevator to the 3rd floor and above would be a problem when the hotel is crowded. Maybe I missed another elevator. All in all, we had a wonderful. comfortable relaxing stay and I'll go back. The rooms are just as nice as the Marriott Waterfront as far as comfort goes. I'm hooked on those beds.This is a great place for fussy older women, young men that have to travel with their mother( the fussy old woman), and families would love it.

Nickel and Dimed to death. The hotel is nice and conveniently located if you're flying out of SeaTac.It's also incredibly expensive for a $200 bed for the night. Parking will run you $16 to find your own place in an otherwise unsecured lot....$52 if you want the valet to do it for you.If you're just staying at the hotel/airport area, make good use of the airport shuttle.Internet connection? You'll pay by the day. Want light? forget it. You'll be dim watt bulbed to the point where you're wondering if they stock flashlights. Water pressure? None. And I was on the 1st floor. Shower was warm, but not hot. I'm all for environmental consideration, but don't make me stumble in the dark or take a cold shower! Shaving your legs in either environment becomes a bloody mess. Literally.The bed was actually incredibly comfortable. Good thing, because the walls and windows are not insulated against airport noise, so ask for an inside room.

Extraordinaily Positive Staff I stayed March 4th and wasn't expecting a lot from this airport hotel. As someone that works for a firm that has gone through the Ritz Carlton seminar, I'm sure this Marriott (which owns Ritz) had its employees go through this process.The room was fine, great pool, decent gym, frequent shuttle to the airport...all that was great. The free Internet with printer is a nice touch as well.Every single employee was amazingly friendly and solicitious - even when I was kind of lost someone would always go out of their way to offer help.There is a lot of construction going on which should be completed soon but it didn't negatively affect me.Good job, Marriott.

Birthday party fun!! We stayed here overnite, one night for my daughter's 16th birthday. Myself ,my daughter and two other friends of hers....We loved the room, two queen beds, one hide a bed(it was surpisingly comfortable!!) And the pool area, so beautiful and relaxing...while the girls swam I rested on one of the chaise lounges....We were swimming at night and they had the atrium area and pool all lit up with lights...So fabulous! They were in a state of remodel in lobby area and some of walkways and corridors to room halls but was not noisy or inconvenient in any way...We live in local area but treat ourselves to this hotel every once in awhile, we are always very pleased with service and amenities....Stay here...you won't be dissapointed!

Excellent stay! We stayed at the hotel for one night and had an excellent stay. They put us in a room on the concierge floor for being a Marriott Rewards Silver member. All of our requests (room with a view of Mt. Rainer, toothpaste, rollaway) were accommodated. The renovated room looked great with comfortable beds and new bedding. We loved the look and feel of the swimming pool/hot tub area (as if we were outdoors in the tropics), and enjoyed the warm water. The food at lunch was very delicious. The hotel is 20 minutes away from downtown Seattle. Note that the lobby is currently being renovated and we needed to walk through a tent to get inside the building and that registration was in the business center.

Great business trip hotel The hotel is somewhat dated but the rooms are very nice and recently remodeled with new furniture, carpet and bedding. The beds have duvet covers and are very clean. Bathrooms were also part of the remodel with granite countertops and new tile and fixtures. I stayed here for two weeks and got to know the hotel very well. The airport side of the hotel is very loud with aircraft noise throughout the night, I had to change to an inside room to get some sleep. The lobby is very dated and needs to be remodeled. Parking is a real problem, the room key does not allow you access out of the parking lot, so every person must stop at the attendant which causes a huge backup at peak times ($14 for this horrible service). The VIP lounge is nice and the staff is very friendly. The inside pool is heated and huge, nice exercise facility. My two week experience was nice, this would be a great hotel if Marriott would spend some money to update the lobby, bar, restaurant and parking access using a card reader.

Sleep, Park and Fly We parked our SUV within 50ft. of the front lobby under two bright lights. We were told it was secure parking. We left the 11th for our first trip to Cabo San Lucas to arrive back home on the 18th to find our SUV broken into with many items stolen, inside damage and things strewn everywhere. We waited for a very long time for the police to arrive to make our report. I have not heard from the corporate office as told as of yet. I made a phone call today and left a message to see how they would like to proceed. I will update once I know if they will stand behind their respected name.

Comfortable but not spacious After staying two nights in the Redmond area for a conference, my wife and I booked this hotel for the last night before our flight home. The hotel lobby had a large fireplace and comforable couches. My wife commented that the pool area (which you pass on an elevated walkway as you make your way to the elevators) looked like something you'd see at Disney with lots of indoor trees/plants. Our room was clean, quiet and nice...but the bathroom felt a bit small. The breakfast buffet was well stocked with all sorts of hot and cold items and also had two cooks on hand for made to order eggs (including a Salmon Scramble which was delicious). We stayed on the top floor (Conceige level, received an upgrade with Marriott points) so the room had an elevated ceiling and I was very impressed with the quality of the decor.
Rooms Are Beautiful After Recent Renovation       Exercise room on 1st level

Hit or miss Stayed here on 2 separate occasions recently. One was great, the other was below average. Rooms have been renovated but found the one on our second stay to be noisy. Food is average hotel fare. Public areas can be dark. $14 a day parking in a lot far from the front desk was disappointing. Shuttle to/from the airport was on time and the drivers helpful. For the price, there has to be better options.

Great hotel July 2006 - We stayed at the Courtyard the night before our Princess cruise to Alaska and were very pleased with the hotel. When we arrived at the Sea-Tac airport, we called for the free hotel shuttle and it arrived about 15 minutes later (we were told 20 minutes so it was early). Driver was very friendly. It was only a 10 minute trip from the airport to the Courtyard. Check-in was fast. Only problem was I thought we could get a free shuttle to the cruise ship but it was too far. But the desk staff did arrange a Town Car service to pick us up next morning. We were guaranteed a non-smoking room and got one. No smell of smoke at all. Room was large with 2 queen beds with down quilts, an overstuffed chair, desk and chair, vanity mirror and bureau with t.v. on it. Very clean. Bathroom was 2-part with toilet and tub/shower in one large room, with the sink and mirror in a separate area outside. Made it convenient. Dinner at Charley's restaurant in the hotel was good and reasonably priced--Western burger with fries and Patty Melt with fries each under $8.95. Breakfast buffet was good too with bread, bagels, omelet bar, fruit, hot and cold cereal, yogurt. We were very pleased with the hotel--especially the cleanliness--and would definitely stay here again.

Pretty impressed Stayed one night here after dropping off our daughter at SeaTac. Yes, this property is a little bit older but we felt that it had been kept up very well. Our room was nicely appointed, the bedding was sooooo comfortable (loved the duvet). We had absolutely no complaints. The pool atrium area was awesome. Lots of real foliage and very bright. We enjoyed our swim in the warm water and time in the hot tub. Would definitely stay here again.
Interesting Marriott Property       Another view of the double beds.
Kind of worn out!   showReview(3484581, 'full');
Below Average, old and tired   showReview(3258421, 'full');

Great place I have stayed at the Del Sol many times and think its a steal as far as the price and the location go. The marina district in san francisco is probably the best locale in the city however there are only motels on lombard that are seedy you would never stay there. Along comes the del sol. it has a monopoly on travelers who want to stay in the marina at a safe nice hotel with no add ons and no frills. the continental breakfast is excellent too.

Great Stay, Great Rooms We stayed at HDS for 5 days from August 15. We have 3 children (5,8,10) and had a great set up. We had room 326 which had a room for the kids, and our room with small kitchen area and bathroom. Really clean and comfortable, very bright and cheery. The breakfast was basic but did the job. Missed a normal cup of tea though. Pool was good for the kids after a day sightseeing. Hotel was in a great area and we walked to Fisherman's Wharf one day. Only negative was hearing noise during the night from both the street and other rooms but I believe they are trying to recify that. Would definately stay there again.

Highly Recommend Hotel Del Sol My stay at Hotel Del Sol was fantastic. It is a clean, quaint, pleasant place very conveniently located to the Marina and the Bay. The staff is very helpful and the rooms are comfortable and spacious. The prices were fair and the breakfast was delicious, especially the coffee.I would definitely stay here again!

Best service EVER at a hotel! We only stayed for one night, but it was wonderful. I had to call the hotel a few times before we arrived and every time anyone who answered was so accomodating. Robin and Jorge who work the front desk are wonderful. They went above and beyond to do whatever it took to make our stay fabulous. The next morning we needed to check out, but weren't flying out until late that night. They helped us plan our entire day and even let us keep our bags behind the front desk while we went sightseeing. When we returned, they had called a car to take us to the airport. I plan to return to San Fran and will never stay anywhere else.
Fun--and just fine       The pool

Great as Always! We stayed at the Hotel Del Sol August 20-24, 2008 for 4 nights. We Have been there before 3 years ago and as it was before, it was a nice experience.We booked the FAMILY SUITE, it comes with 1 queen bed in one room and a children's room with a twin trundle bed (it used to have bunk beds, not sure why they changed, safety perhaps?). This is a nice room for a family of 4-6 as the childen's room has enough room to throw a twin blow up mattress or two on the floor. The room also comes with a mini kitchenette. When I say MINI I mean mini, very small, but enough room to bring snacks, a few cold drinks in the 'fridge, small sink, etc.They offer a breakfast but it's very basic. Danish, bagels, toast, bananas, apples, coffee, juice, milk and THAT'S IT! If that's enough for you, it's great and saves a few bucks as SF is expensive!Also, on Friday night they offer a bbq although they don't advetise it much. Make sure to ask the front desk about it. We forgot all about it and by the time we got back from sightseeing, we missed it.The front desk staff are very knowlegable about the buses, local eateries, etc. Very helpful.The hotel is in a nice area, the Marina District, close to so much: Golden Gate Bridge, Fort Mason, Fisherman's Wharf and everything else is a bus or cable car ride away!!All in all we had a great stay at HDS, as we did before and we will stay again in the future.

Not convinced The hotel does the basics quite well but do not expect too much.The location is a plus, quite central, some nearby shops and reasonably priced cafes and about a 15-20 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf.Breakfast can be a bit sparse and you grab and go, either sitting outside if there is room or take things back to your bedroom. Supplies are replenished but you'll probably need more if you're used to a good breakfast.Rooms can be bit noisy with other guests walking around.There are additional support structures holding up the top 2 floors which are a bit concerning when you arrive.Car parking can be tight and we usually finished up in the overflow area in the next street.Overall adequate, but would probably not stay here again.

Value? Our family stayed here for three days and have mixed feelings about the hotel. We loved the location, it was off the beaten path, but close to Union street which had lots to look at and eat. The marina district was fun to get to know and we enjoyed our time away from the hotel. The hotel recently (I guess) has had some issues with structural support or something, because there were exposed support pillars with yellow tape put all over them holding up the second floor. We didn't notice any sagging or dangerous looking cracks, but it wasn't what we expected when arriving. The walls and ceiling were thin in our room and we joked about the dinosaurs wrestling upstairs each night. The pool was small, but the weather wasn't hot enough for that to be an issue. Parking was free, but if you couldn't find a parking space inside the courtyard you had to park next door where there are signs every 10 feet telling you to take everything out of your car which doesn't leave you with the most confident feeling about the neighborhood. Our room was small, but clean and functional. The bathroom was Parisian in size and didn't have space to place our daily toiletries . Breakfast was very basic (coffee, orange juice, rolls) and we ended up eating breakfast away from the hotel to fill up. The overall value of the hotel is questionable. We paid $177 a night thinking we would save money on parking and breakfast, but it didn't work out as well as planned. San Francisco is an expensive place, so I am not sure if there are better places out there for families looking to cut costs. Next time I go to SF I will probably not stay at the Hotel Del Sol.

Great Family of 5 Hotel in San Francisco! Stayed at Hotel Del Sol based on TA recommendations and one from a friend. Very nice, quaint motor lodge, very colorful, I almost felt as if we were in another time/place than San Francisco! Our room was nice for a family of 5, convenient to ride the bus all around, great thai restaurant behind the hotel. Very nice bar b que for the hotel guests on Friday, July 4 that we all enjoyed, didn't know the marina district was so close and so cool. I would definately recommend this hotel again to another large family, the gentleman doing the bar b que and stocking the continental breakfast was incredibly nice. The breakfast was so so, but these are lean hard times. The pool was smalled than what we thought, but hey, it's San Francisco! We just really enjoyed Hotel Del Sol, thanks for all who wrote in.

Good hotel for the price If you are accustomed to staying at 4 or 5 star hotels, this isn't the place for you. If you are looking for a clean and spacious room in a quiet motor inn for a reasonable rate, this is a good bet. Our family of 4 stayed in a suite - bedroom and living room with a pullout sofa. The pullout sofas aren't the most comfortable beds in the world but if your kids aren't from The princess and the pea, it is fine. It was nice to have a refrigerator so we could have cold drinks. The bathroom is a bit small but functional and the nice soap and toiletries were a special touch. There is also a safe in one of the closets. At one point the toilet needed a plunger and a handyman showed up at the door within a minute of hanging up the phone.The staff is incredibly helpful and even gave us the addresses for the Mrs. Doubtfire house and the Full House home. Upon check-in there were cookies in the lobby and the morning breakfast (eaten poolside) was a nice way to start the day. The bright decor puts you in a festive mood and the hammocks in the courtyard are a great way to relax. Again, it was amazing how quiet it was at night - I credit the management staff who reminds people upon check -in that they need to be considerate of others (sad that they need to actually tell people that but we're thankful that they do)We walked to everything from here as we do on every vacation but I know that there is a nearby bus stop. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend the hotel.

Quaint Hotel! We were guests at the Del Sol 6/20 - 6/23, 2008. Overall, we liked this hotel and would recommend it. The location is terrific for touring San Francisco by cable car, by foot or by the MUNI. The complimentary BBQ the evening of our arrival was a HUGE plus as was the free parking on premises. This hotel is kid-friendly with a nice sized court yard next to the pool for play. There were two minor issues: 1. The telephones in our room were not operational. 2. The remote controls provided did not operate either of the TV's in our suite. Many of the guests we met were repeat visitors. We would likely return to this hotel when visiting San Francisco in the future.

Hotel del Sol was perfect for our family! We stayed two nights at the Hotel del Sol in the Marina district of San Francisco. It was the perfect place for our family. The hotel is one of those true motels built around a motor court. It has been updated with vibrant colors and basic but comfortable amenities. For us the location was ideal. Once we pulled into our FREE parking spot, we never used our car again until we left. The hotel clerks were knowledgeable, friendly and helpful. They helped us figure out the public transportation, restaurant reservations and more. At days end the pool was fabulous. It is not huge, but it is clean and has a shallow end for my little one. They provide pool toys, goggles, etc. My kids were satisfied with the basic bagel and pastry breakfast. But the hotel is also very close to many cafes and other restaurants if you want more. If you are looking for luxury, go to Union Square, but if you want a clean, family-friendly place then this is it. I would stay there again as it fit my budget and my style perfectly.

Not for older travelers Five of us stayed here in 2 rooms. Two of us were 70 years old at the time of the trip. I would not book them here again. Although there is an elevator, there are still stairs that have to be negotiated once you exit the elevator, regardless of where your room is. This was difficult for the older travelers among us, and something that would keep me from booking them at this hotel again. There is also a big disparity in the size of the rooms. One room was a king. The other had 2 double beds. The double bed room was the smallest hotel room I have been in the US. I would say it was average size for a European hotel room. In contrast the king room had a kitchen with fridge, microwave, utensils, an extra pull out couch, and a big bathroom. Also, both rooms had showers only, which may not work for those with kids who still take baths. On the upside, the location is great, if you don't want to be with the tourist hoards near Ghiradelli Square and Fisherman's Wharf. We have always liked Cow Hollow and chose the hotel for that reason. Our daughter loved the heated pool. Public transportation (bus) is easy from the hotel. The people who work at the hotel are nice and will quiet people down who violate the quiet hours rule. I don't know if I would stay here again, but it may be the best choice in the neighborhood. Free parking is a huge bonus, and when the spots fill up underneath the hotel, they have a lot across the street.

great stay They went above and beyond what they needed to for under 200 dollars in San Fran. 7 minutes you were at the water. We stayed here to compete in the Alcatraz Triathlon and thought it was a great location. The only issue is the rooms are open to the outside with people walking by. First night we were awakened frequently second night we turned on the AC and the noise blocked out the outside noise. Breakfast in the morn with paper was nice touch. 5 min drive to Golden Gate Bridge.

Wish we could have stayed longer! We just completed a road trip through California traveling down the coast with our 3 kids. We all loved the Hotel Del Sol. We appreciated the convenient parking this hotel offers. Traveling with kids, I appreciated having a door to our bedroom. We enjoyed the clean room and colorful decor. I highly recommend purchasing a City Pass which allows free transportation and passes to the Exploratorium and Aquarium of the Bay. Though the hotel isn't located close to the wharf or other areas where you see a lot of hotels, with our City Pass, we found it easy to get anywhere we wanted to go. We loved Pizza Orgasmica around the corner and had take out with a bottle of wine from a store nearby. One night the hotel hosted a happy hour with food for both kids and adults. Would definitely stay here again!

Central Location, Nice Rooms, good for the Value My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Del Sol for a wedding. We are both in our Mid-20's. 2 blocks from the bars off of Union, $7 cab ride to Pier 39, $8 cab ride to snob hill. They had a free BBQ and drinks for us on Friday night in the fun courtyard. The downsides which my gf didn't care for was the single room with 2 double beds (hard beds might I mention) and a small pool. $199 a night is a good value and had a great time in SF.

Cool Hotel, Ok Location This is a funky motel that has been jazzed up to make it cool and chic. As an ex-San Franciscan it was a fun place to stay, but I don't think I would recommend it for first time travelers. It is a little off the beaten path.It worked great for us because we could go visit the playground and a couple other haunts my girls loved. the rooms were really clean. The pool is outdoor which in SF is a waste -- too cold to use it. And don't bring a big car or you won't be able to park it in their garage.

Great family hotel Last August we stayed at the Hotel Del Sol, in the Cow Hollow district of San Francisco for 4 days. We have 3 boys and stayed in one of their suites. We loved this hotel. The living room had a pull out couch for the boys, a TV, refridgerator, and some chairs. There was a separate bedroom for us and a regular bathroom. The hotel had continental breakfast every day and we brought it up to our room and ate in the living room. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is great, in a quiet neighborhood but still accessible to all the buses. We did a lot of bus travel and walking. There is a pool but it was too cold for us. San Francisco is chilly in August! The hotel also has a small sauna that we used a few times.The hotel also provides free parking with the price of your room which was a great bonus. This is really a great place for families who want to be in the city.

Nice place at a good price! We stayed at the Hotel del Sol while in town for a four day vacation/family visit. Overall, the hotel is lovely. The rooms are average-sized and comfortable, the grounds are very nice and the staff are amazing - universally friendly and accommodating. In fact, they are probably the best hotel staff I have encountered in 30 years of traveling. The hotel is in the Cow Hollow/Marina district, which means it is not in the heart of tourist San Francisco; if you're looking for that, you'd be better off booking a hotel near Fisherman's Wharf. What the area around the Hotel del Sol does provide is a lively neighborhood feel with tons of nice restaraunts, parks and shops within easy walking distance. The only remotely negative thing about this hotel is that it does cater to families with children, which means that occasionally you will run into parents who think vacation means that they don't have to discipline their children. We were on the second floor, and the children in the room above us were practicing their skateboard jumps at 10 p.m. I called the front desk, and the problem was taken care of immediately - another example of the great service we found at this hotel. Still, in the future, I plan to book a room on the top floor to avoid further problems.

Not as good as it used to be, but still a good choice We just spent the weekend at the Del Sol - we chose it because the location is great (Cow Hollow neighbourhood) and we'd stayed there before a few years back and were very pleased. The property isn't as nice as it used to be and they no longer offer Aveda products (which was one of my favorite things before). Sound carries quite a bit so ask for a room on the top floor if available. Rooms are small but clean and the furnishings are starting to become a bit dated. Also, the picture on our TV was very poor - we couldn't watch a couple of the channels. Parking is included - which is a great feature for SF - and the location is great - walking distance to many shops and restaurants in a pretty trendy area. Would probably stay elsewhere next time if given the choice unless they do some refurbishing.

Fun Hotel but there must be better places to stay We chose the Hotel del Sol for our 5 day stay in San Francisco on the basis that the reviews indicated it might be fun for our two boys (9 and 17) , that it had a pool and because it had free parking. In fact Hotel de Sol is a motel rather than a hotel and the fact that all the rooms overlook a central public courtyard means that all are inherently noisy. Fortunately during our stay the other guests were not making much noise, but I could imagine that if you were unlucky and your stay co-incided with that of a rowdy group, it could be pretty unpleasant. The pool is very small and not really worthwhile, and whilst on site car parking was a great bonus I think that next time I would get rid of the hire car when reaching San Francisco and get by using public transport. That said a drive out to Muir Wood is well worth while. The hotel location is not good. It is not near anything of interest. Admittedly the bus stop is only two blocks away, but you have to use the bus to go everywhere, which is time consuming.The staff were superb. Very friendly and extremely helpful. The hotel provides a light breakfast, even though it does not have the facilities to do so. You get your bagels and coffee from reception and the sit by the pool. The buildings and rooms are colourful and jolly, and a big benefit for us was that the price was such that we could afford to have two rooms rather than having to share a room with our boys. On reflection though it would have been better to have found a hotel in Fisherman's Wharfe (I'm not sure which however as none stood out as looking particularly welcoming).We took a night trip to Alcatraz which was fantastic - one of the best tourist trips I have ever done. The boys also really enjoyed the Exploratorium (Science Museum).People had warned my that San Fracisco would be cold, but I hadn't really believed them. We left Sacramento (80 miles inland) with the temperature at 95 F, and when we got to San Francisco it was only 60 F. It stayed like that all week. This was, however, a welcome relief from the heat we had experienced during the remainder of our trip.Overall, although Hotel del Sol is great fun, my advice would be to find a hotel in either Fisherman's Wharfe or Union Square.
Comfy, festive, friendly       The hotel room

Hotel Del Sol Great for Families! We stayed at the Hotel Del Sol at the end of July. We loved it! We had room 322, a standard room with 2 double beds. The 1950's motor lodge style hotel and the rooms are brightly colored, what I would call art-deco. There is a nice courtyard with a small pool. The pool was quite chilly for adults but my kids, ages 4  7 didn't seem to mind. The afternoon cookies and milk were also a hit. Back to the room. I won't deny that the room is quite small and the bathroom consisted of a pedistal sink, shower stall, and commode. That said, who comes to San Francisco to stay in their room?!! The beds were very comfortable and the boutique soaps and shampoos were a treat. Our room overlooked Greenwich Street so we didn't get the traffic noise I read in other reviews. We were also on the top floor which probably helped in that area as well. The hotel was fully booked but the little bit of noise we heard died down by 10 pm. Continental breakfasts were standard fare but in a city where you pay big $$ to eat, any free breakfast is a bonus. The biggest appeal to me was the location. The marina/Cow Hollow district is a wonderful,safe location. There are kid friendly restaurants within walking distance such as Mel's Drive-In Diner and Amici's Pizzeria along Lombard St. If you want something that offers a quieter dining experience with delicious adult fare as well as a kid menu, Perry's on Union St. is also great. Parking is FREE at Hotel Del Sol but a car in SF is unnecessary. We bought MUNI passes for each of us (kids under 5 ride free). The bus stop is a few blocks from the hotel. Since it is a main line, we were able to go everywhere with ease. The neighborhood is very safe, great for evening strolls and the hotel is within walking distance to the Presidio, Chrissy Field, The Exploratorium, and the Palace of Fine Arts. Walking around the neighborhoods looking at the architecture also is a San Francisco must-see. On a final note, I have to say the staff at the Hotel Del Sol is what really makes this place stand out. I had booked a rental car for the day we were checking out and heading to Yosemite. There was a problem with Enterprise (what a nightmare). When Jorge heard of our problem, he offered to call other rental car companies for us and after an hour located a car with Avis. He also allowed us to keep our room until Avis came to pick us up which was almost 4 pm. The others at the Front desk were also so very helpful. They have pocket size maps there that are invaluable. Ask them for a recommendation and they happily give you 3!

A refreshing hotel! My mom and I stayed at Hotel Del Sol for a few nights while we were in San Francisco. The hotel was recommended to me and it didn't disappoint. The location was perfect - a few blocks from Union and Chestnut, walking distance to the ocean - and the ambiance was very refreshing. Small, basic rooms with bright colors and lots of character. An outdoor pool, parking and a small continental breakfast was also part of the deal. It definitely had a European feel and that may have been because it seemed to be mostly European travelers staying there. The price was incredibly reasonable and we'll definitely be back. It's nice to find a hotel that doesn't break the bank and isn't part of some boring ol' chain.

Disappointed We booked this hotel entirely due to the favourable reviews on this site. And while there were some nice things about it (I'll get to those), overall we were quite disappointed. The whole time I was there, I kept thinking, I can't wait to write a review of this place on TripAdvisor.  The main problem was the tiny, cramped rooms (at least the one we had, it was a standard-type room with 2 queen beds). Everyone's face fell when we first walked in. It was claustrophobic. I have re-read many of the reviews now that I'm back, and even many of the favourable ones do mention the small rooms.The bathroom was equally cramped, with only space for a shower stall. This disappointed me further, as I am a bath person. Another disappointment was the lack of a fridge, something we always appreciate in a hotel room.Another disappointment was the size of the swimming pool (not much bigger than a bathtub) and the cold temperature of the water.The courtyard itself was nicely done up, in particular at night with the lights on the palm trees. Breakfast was fairly uninteresting (continental style danishes etc.), but I'm not really complaining here -- I'd rather have a simple breakfast than none at all. Cookies offered every afternoon at 4:00 were appreciated by my kids. Another thing I did like was the hair products, moisturizer and soaps. They were lovely.Next time we stay in San Fran, we will definitely try somewhere else.

hotel is overrated My family stayed at the Hotel del Sol for four days in August 2007. We payed $209 for a suite which was supposedly a discounted price. Frankly, we were disappointed. This is very much a brightly painted noisy motel. The rooms were very small, the pool tiny and freezing, and the continental breakfast fair at best. I realize San Francisco is very expensive, and that parking is included (which is a big deal), however, it is still overpriced. On the plus side, it is extremely well located, and the people at the desk, as well as housekeeping, were lovely. On my next trip to San Francisco, I would pay more if necessary, but stay at a nicer place.

A Ray of Sunshine We booked this Hotel based on reviews and were not disappointed. When we arrived from the UK we discovered that our booking was for 2008, not 2007 (oops!), but the guy on reception didn't bat an eyelid. He put us in a 'spare' room (we were so tired after the flight we didn't really care where we went...) and then moved all our stuff into a better room the morning after. When I was awake at 4am (time difference etc etc) the very cheerful night porter made me coffee to go. With 2 young children in tow we were so grateful that our mistake was sorted out so easily and without fuss - 10/10 Hotel del Sol!The hotel is tidy and neat, bright and cheerful. There is good family dining very close by (Mel's Diner, pizza, chinese, japanese etc) and a very short walk to excellent public transport links. It is also a very easy and pleasant walk along the front to the Fisherman's Wharfe area and all the touristy bits.San Francisco was cool and misty, so the hotel pool was equally cool, but it was still great to go for a dip and a splash with the kids.Breakfast was standard fare (juice, coffee, bagels/cream cheese, pastries and fruit) and more than adequate. Staff were all cheerful, friendly and, in our case, went out of their way to sort out our 'little' error.I'd recommend this hotel to anyone wanting no-frills, comfortable accomodation away from the city centre hustle and bustle, but close enough to get there easily.

Great place to stay with your kids A friend of a friend recommended this place for our 3 night stay in San Francisco. Everything was wonderful. We arrived and there were freshly baked cookies for all. Parking was free. The kids hung out at the pool each afternoon, and a continental breakfast helped us get going in the morning. We loved the neighborhood (happy to be out of the Union Square buzz) and found the the Hotel Del Sol staff could direct us by bus anywhere we wanted to go. We walked a lot, found great local restaurants and a great organic type supermarket all nearby. We also had the suite room (separate spaces for adults and kids). Would return here in a minute.

decent hotel Decent hotel, includes parking and a simple breakfast (bagels with cream cheese  jam, coffee, hot chocolate, tea, milk, orange juice), cookies in afternoon. One clerk was very friendly, another less so. Food recommendations were blah (pasta place -- forgot it's name, was ho-hum, sandwich place (submarines) was also very average). Pool was freezing cold. Elevator brightly painted, jolts to a stop. To reach room on 3d floor, need to go up/down a few steps (warning to strollers). Bathroom had only a shower, but that was okay. Nice shampoo/hand cream. Parking was tight (but included). Room was brightly coloured and cheerful, clean with adequate storage.We were quoted $189 over the phone in June, when we arrived, someone in front of us got the same kind of room (2 dbl beds) for $129. So, I asked for and got that price. Check before checking in!

Good option for families We booked 3 nights at the Hotel del Sol largely because of its reputation as a family-friendly place, and by-and-large were not disappointed. We had a room with a queen bed, and another room (which may have been a converted bathroom) that was very small but our 5 and 6 year-olds loved the trundle bed and the age-appropriate children's decorations. We also asked for a crib for our 1 year-old and although space was a little tight, we were all reasonably comfortable.The afternoon cookies and milk were a hit, as was the courtyard pool (although the wind at times was pretty fierce). Breakfast was really nothing special, but the chance to start our day with coffee and pastries/bagels while we spent a leisurely morning planning our day was invaluable!Location can't be beat, and regarding the noise and thin walls - our solution was turn on the air conditioning/heating unit at night. The white noise drowned out a lot (although we never were too bothered by noise) and made sleeping more comfortable.The staff were friendly and even let me park on the small lawn in the courtyard when available parking was tight. All in all, the positives outweighed the slight negatives (smallish rooms, some oddities in room structure/size). For those families with unlimited budgets, a fancy hotel suite near Union Square might be more stylish, but the Hotel Del Sol is a very good option if you're on a budget and don't mind a little funkiness!

Stay away if noise bothers you The Hotel Del Sol is okay for what it is. However if noise is an issue, this is not the hotel for you.We enjoyed the use of colour in attempting to convert a 60's motel into something more current. However, at the end fo the day, it remains a 60's motel. No bathtub. No hooks in the bathroom. Over three days, used up bath soap was not replaced. Too few electrical outlets resulting is so many things added to an outlet that I started to worry.Rooms were small so that even at $229 for a one bedroom, 3 people were cramped. Breakfast was coffee, juice, fruit and either overly sweet doughnuts (for breakfast????) or little bagels that had to be cut with a bagel cutter that did more to mash the bagel. And the NOISE!!!!! If you kept all of your windows closed, it was okay. However, with a slightly open window, you were kept awake at night by street traffic, arguments in the street or hotel guests noisily departing at 6:45am. Even with your windows closed, if you were so unfortunate to stay at the hotel as a group of middle aged folks on motor cycles, who loved to rev or even idle their hogs, the entire building literally shook.$7.99 per day for internet. OUCH!For the price, I was not impressed.However, location is always a plus and one of Hotel Del Sol's advantages is its accessibility to key areas of the City. One and one half short blocks away a #30 Muni bus will take you to Fisherman's Wharf (except for the trip to Alcatraz, why you would want to go there, I don't know) in five to ten minutes and to Union Square in 20-25 minutes while passing through North Beach and Chinatown and great views of Alcatraz and Coit Tower on Telelgraph Hill along the way. The trip alone is worth the price of a ticket. If you will have a car, free parking is a major plus to be factored into the price.A friendly and helpful day and afternoon staff. Night staff could not tell me how to access messages.The hotel is close to the fun restaurants of Chestnut Street and an easy walk from the upscale shops of Union Street.So, for the location and the free parking, and if you want to keep your windows closed at all times and avoid their breakfast and the internet, it is a reasonable choice.

You can't go wrong with Hotel del Sol We loved this hotel. It has a lot of character, the staff were very helpful and friendly-- a very hospitable place. My kids were very welcome there, the breakfast was amazing, and they even have a generous spread of cheese, crackers, wine, etc on Friday afternoons. There are warm cookies for the kids every afternoon. We felt very welcome there. We stayed in a one bedroom suite which was very spacious with two large closets. I have two minor complaints-- the walls are very thin, and the mattress we had sagged a little. However, for the price (by San Francisco standards anyway), I think this hotel was great and I highly recommend it.

Great for families arriving in SF by car Our family arrived via minivan for five days in SF. I booked a room here based on being able to have a two-room suite and the generally excellent reviews the hotel receives in guidebooks. We found during our stay at the Hotel Del Sol that it exceeded our high expectations in almost every way. The longer we were there, the better we liked it. Those downgrading the hotel either 1) expected it to be something it's not (i.e. a posh hotel, a place in the middle of walkable tourist areas, something w/rooms resembling a Hampton or Quality inn--it pretends to be none of these) or 2) need to use the forum to register some minor beef that most people absorb as part of the normal hassles of traveling, esp with a family. That said, here's our experience w/four people.The general feel of the hotel is really nice and, for a city, very safe. Instead of the courtyard making things seems overly noisy and familiar, which is what I expected, the grounds outside came to feel familiar and homey. Our children are not urban-savvy kids. It was nice to be in a city and not spend our time watching their backs, as we would have to do in any Union Square, or even Fisherman's Wharf, location. There were lots of European travelers staying here; I understand why: if you're arriving from another country, it's a very reassuring place and location in which to land.There are fabulous places to walk and eat either two blocks to the north or two to the south. There's also fast food (taco bell, the colonel's chicken) w/in a block. There's small grocery stores a block away and one of the city's best Safeways five blocks away. There's one of the best running routes I've ever been on right out the door toward the marina and the GG bridge (the SF marathon goes along the route). There's a park one block away. There's easy car access to the bridge, Golden Gate Park, and the rest of the city, if you're inclined to drive and park other places. I can't imagine a better location in which to stay, unless you need to walk out the door and be in the middle of everything. (Having lived in NYC, we likened staying here to the equivalent of getting a hotel on the upper-west-side of NYC, out of the throng of mid-town.)Plenty has been written about the rooms, the great breakfast (w/the consistently best breakfast coffee we've ever had) and other stuff, so I'll not add to that. Our only beef, room-wise, was terrible shower water pressure. Don't know if that was a city-pipe, hotel-pipe, or shower-head issue.All in all, I'd return to the HDS in a heartbeat, though would make my reservations as early as possible so I could claim just the configuration in a suite I wanted, as they are all laid out a bit differently.

Okay, Not Amazing We booked this hotel after reading all the super positive reviews here on TripAdvisor, and after viewing the hotel's own website...We were disappointed. The pros: Great location in the Marina District with great restaurants and the waterfront within short walking distance. We loved the Marina neighborhood and loved being away from the more touristed areas of the city. The hotel is perky, pretty and fun--on the outside. Good quality bagels and pastries and fresh bananas for breakfast. We did enjoy this morning meal.The cons: We had a room with 2 full beds (not 2 queens). Bedding was average, not the best comfort. Really, this hotel was only comfortable for the 2 nights we stayed there. The room was fairly small, the bathroom: very small. Also, the bathroom was in sorry shape, with rust evident and a worn, small shelf. No hand-held shower. Really, the bathroom reminded me of college apartment digs. Quirky and funky can be okay, but when I travel, I want to feel comfortable and clean in the bathroom.The front desk guys were young, and a bit cavalier to my taste. I mean, they were nice enough... There was just not a level of professionalism that let me feel I was in competent hands.Overall, this is a good choice for a quick visit...nothing to get too excited about. I traveled with my husband and young daughter. I don't know what all the fuss is regarding this being the best family choice in SanFran.I don't mean to be a nay-sayer...We simply didn't find this to be the outstanding place it is hyped as. Happy Travels!

Cow Hollow is a great area to stay Small 3-story old and nicely updated hotel. Colorful, quaint, relaxing. Great location for restaurants (Chestnut, Union), history, transportation, shopping (go straight up Fillmore).ROOM: #319 Jr. Suite. Fridge, Q bed-comfortable  comfy quilt, clean bathroom w/light in shower, sofa bed a little uncomfortable, roomy, 2 mod-sized closets, safe, tv, vcr. ELEVATOR: old and jumps at the end of the ride. POOL: nice, sunny, good temp, clean, 3ft-8ft, nice to have breakfast or snacks around. Tall palm trees w/lights-nice effect. PARKING: free! our Toyota 4-Runner fit. RESTAURANTS: must go to Chestnut, also a Walgreens. BUS: Muni-#30 goes to Ghiradelli Sq. If you stay on, it goes up Columbus (Italian district, City LIghts Bookstore), and continues up to Chinatown. Also goes near Baseball Park. Runners: will enjoy running around the area--very close to Crissy Field/Fort Mason/Exploratorium. Stayed Fri-Mon for marathon. BREAKFAST: OJ, coffee, doughnuts, bagels, pastries-the usual. Fri  Sat nights were noisy from people on the street until @ 2:30am. Had to keep window closed. Overall...yes, would stay here again.

Excellent Family Choice We stayed four nights at Hotel Del Sol during a 10-day California trip with my wife and two daughters - ages 7 and 8. We booked in advance into one of the two room suites, which worked perfectly for us and was well worth the few extra dollars. The beds (even the pull-out!!) were very comfortable, and the DVD player was a nice surprise. Only issue we had was a lack of closet space and a very tiny bathroom- but we coped with both just fine. We enjoyed the continental breakfast every morning, and were pleasantly surprised by the variety and quality of the food - especially for a complimentary breakfast. My daughters made there way into the pool a couple of times despite the eary June chilly days.The location was OK, a very safe neighborhood that doesn't feel too crowded. However, it did take a bit of patience on occasion to get a taxi or to catch the bus. Best bet is to call down to the front desk 5-10 minutes before you want to leave and have them call you a cab and it should be there waiting when you get down. We ate in one of the restaurants in the area, which was recommended as a casual family place by the front desk, but we were unimpressed. There were several places very close by that I would have loved to try, but didn't look great for kids.The free, convenient parking was a big plus. Several commented about the overflow lot. This was not a problem at all as it was just across the street. Overall, we will gladly stay here again if we make another family trip to San Francisco.  - Spike and Family

Great choice! What a great hotel. First of all the staff was above average. The young man, George was absolutely wonderful. He helped us out tremendously. He knew where to go and where not to go. He made us feel like we were at home. The location is right off of Lombard Street/Hwy 101 which is a busy road but a taxi or car is easy to call and get around S.F. We had the family suite and the kids loved their own room and own beds. What a great theme. It had a real european feel to it. We had a great time at this hotel. Well worth the money.

Good value We just returned from our stay in San Francisco staying at The Hotel Del Sol for a week. The front desk people were so helpful and kind, the location was great (between lots of dining options on Chestnut and Union Streets) and we appreciated the ease of the Hotel Del Sol--not in the touristy Fisherman's Wharf area, etc. The bus system was confusing to us at first, but once we got the hang of it, we traveled all over the city. We also rented a car to get out of the city for a few day trips.Every night was quiet except for Saturday night when the bars got out (we were with our two year old and so had early bedtimes and rising times). We stayed in a small suite and we felt that it was a good value for the money. Unfortunately, the cribs they had were pack and plays which were too small for our child, but overall this was a good family place to stay. The front desk loaned us a few Sesame Street videos and books for a particularly fussy evening. Like other reviews mention, The Hotel Del Sol is really a glorified motel, but it feels clean, safe, quiet and accomodating. We would definitely stay there again!

Nice staff but loud My family with children of nearly adult age spent one night here. The room was nice. The front desk clerk was helpful and polite. However, the walls are thin and we could hear way more than we wanted to.. Unattended children woke me up by knocking on our door,. I heard them say they had the wrong room. I felt there was a lack of privacy at this property.The courtyard is cute but looks more spacious in photos than it actually is. It is quirky that you drive your car into the courtyard for covered parking. The continental breakfast is nice, but look out for incoming cars as you are sitting at tables in the courtyard! Free parking is a perk and is the reason we stayed here the last night in SF. We paid quite a bit for what we got in return. Definitely not a good choice for light sleepers or the young -child-phobic.

FUN, FRIENDLY and FABULOUS LOCATION We booked the 2 bedroom family room and a rollaway was arranged for us. We were travelling with three older teenage boys and there was plenty of room.A small kitchenette was useful although more utensils are needed.Rooms are bright and cheerful and spotlessly clean. The decor is lovely. There is a small pool and the lights in the trees add a special feel at night.The staff are extremely friendly and helpful.Breakfast is plentiful and you can have it in the sun by the pool.Buses are close by to all the places you may want to go.Like other reviewers we loved the location. A quick walk to Mel's Diner for my 'car mad' men was a dinner treat but there are many lovely little places to eat and to browse.Stay here and bus to wherever you need to go.We bought a 3 day MUNI pass which gives you unlimited bus and cable car rides and with it you can go just about anywhere.Thank you Hotel Del Sol..............a lovely experience.

Great value - We will stay here next time in SF! We are a family of 4 from Sweden that made a trip from coast to coast. We had 4 days at this hotel in this wonderful town. Excellent nice personell, close to a busline that takes you to the heart of SF in 5 minutes. We do recommend this hotel, nice clean rooms. One day when we came back in the afternoon there was a barbecue by the pool. We thougt it was for some special company of people - Its for you they told us! Nice, even wine... at no extra charge.The Martensson family

Nervous at first, but warmed up to Hotel Del Sol We booked our 5 day stay at Hotel Del Sol, based on the Frommer's Guide recommendation of it as one of the 'Most Family-Friendly Hotels' in SF  the generally good Tripadvisor reviews. When we first arrived, I was disappointed because it really is more 'motel' than 'hotel'. I was nervous that the thin walls  proximity to the street would make for noisy, sleepless nights. Not so! We never had a significant problem with noise(we did hear some foot traffic on the stairs in the morning, but we were usually awake by then, anyway) Hotel Del Sol is very clean and comfortable. Nice bedding and we loved those Aveda products! The staff was wonderful  very helpful. Also, appreciated the free parking. My kids loved: the milk  cookies in the afternoon(warm, chewy cookies), the hammock  the pool. We skipped the breakfasts, because there are so many great breakfast spots in the neighborhood  we'd rather drink cappuccino than regular coffee. I'm so glad we didn't stay in some tourist trap like Union Square or Fisherman's Wharf because I think you get a better sense of the city in a place like this. We loved the neighborhood, which is pretty laid back, but full of shopping  food options  walking distance to plenty of sites, like Crissy Field  Fisherman's Wharf(longish walk, but totally do-able) I'd definitely stay there again with my kids (but would opt for something more refined if it were just me  my husband).

good value/location Stayed for 4 days, family mini vacation with two children. We were looking for a safe, clean hotel on a budget.Location.easy to get to / from via transit. excellent restaurant choices nearby (I reccomend Amicis' for pasta and breadsticks). Felt safe whenever we went out in the area, after going by several other hotels in our travels that we had considered in other areas of the city we felt we made a good choice for location.Rooms.Stayed in a regular room for 2 days and upgraded to one bedroom for rest of stay, both rooms were clean and about what we expecteded for the money.Service.Excellent staff, very friendly and helpful. The breakfast and the milk and cookies in the evening were both great.

Great for Families I looked through several trip advisor results for hotels in San Francisco. I finally settled on the Hotel Del Sol. We got to the hotel about 30 min. early and our room was not ready which was fully understandable because we were early. They apologized and then upgraded us to a 1 bedroom suite for the inconvience. I was very suprised because we had arrived early and did not ask to be upgraded. What a way to start off the trip! Then when we got in our room there were treats for my 3 yr old and a complimentary trip to the aqaurium of the bay. Everyone was so nice and I will return anytime I go to the city again. Thank you to the staff at the hotel del sol....your customer service was wonderful. The rooms were clean and well stocked. I can not rave enough about this hotel.

Not Cookie Cutter - Very Nice Free Breakfast - Good Value Good central location in the Marina District. Older Motel-type Hotel. Rooms are different, very clean and brightly colored. On a Sunday night there was very litte street traffic ( but always some -it's a city). In the AM in the lobby, there's a continental breakfast with juice , cereal, coffee, fruit and (surprisingly) top-of-the-line pastries. Free SF Chronicle too. Tiny outdoor pool; very friendly service. Because of it's unusual/funky decor, friendly staff and small size - even the other guests say, Hi - unusual in a city hotel.Price without taxes for a Sunday night was $139. You can't beat that price for a clean, medium-size hotel room in mid-town SF.

Lovely Staff and Area Rooms Disappointing We booked this hotel based on previous reviews. Firstly, the main reason for booking this hotel was their bunk bed family suite rooms as our children are a girl and a boy ages 12 and 14 and too big for the usual pull out trundle beds, hence, it was great to find a hotel with such rooms. We had a few problems with our booking, when we arrived at the hotel we were advised that infact, these rooms no longer exist and the receptionist advised us that someone should have informed us of this at the time of booking (bearing in mind that we phoned up and booked three months previous and specifically asked for the bunk bed room, at the time we were actually at the hotel end Dec 2006 to Jan 3rd 2007 these rooms were still advertised on their web site). The staff at this hotel are faultless, infact, possibly the most friendly and helpful staff I have ever come across the reception staff are excellent as are the cleaning staff and the general porters. I do have to say though that overall I was disappointed with The Hotel Del Sol, I don't quite get the hype with this hotel, it quite literally is just a bog standard motel and not even as brightly coloured and outrageous as I had expected I guess. As previously mentioned the rooms are fairly noisy there is alot of traffic noise from late evening and early morning when you hear the buses and lorries, infact, we could hear so much outside noise that you would swear that your windows weren't properly shut! The motel is fairly compact and each part of the hotel is serviced by rear outside stairs, and there is a constant stream of guests and staff up and down the stairs at all hours, and also as previously mentioned, the noise from the heating/air conditioning from your neighbouring room will drive you crazy. The toilets at the hotel constantly blocked up so much so that we no longer went and asked for a plunger! we went to the broom cupboard and helped ourselves as the need for one was so frequent! When we finally checked out of the hotel the receptionist was kind enough to deduct a couple of dollars from our bill due to the inconvenience we had at not getting the bunk bed room which was a nice gesture. But I can honestly say that we will be in San Francisco again this year but we won't be staying at the Hotel Del Sol again, it just isn't value for money and for this money I expect a little more room comfort, space and quietness and above all a little undisturbed sleep!!!

Very Nice and helpful people Overall the hotel is everything that is written on these boards. The management and front desk people are wonderful. They will go out of their way to help you. They let us check in early and check out late. They helped us find open restaurants on Christmas Eve and Christmas Day.It is within walking distance to many restaurants, shops, and interesting streets. We walked from here to Union Square, Fisherman's Wharf, North Beach etc.The bus lines are right around the corner.The only con of this hotel are the paper thin walls. We actually heard the guy next door to us snoring. It really didn't bother us too much, but if you don't like noise this is probably not the place for you.

Very comfortable beds; colourful and clean Great little hotel - a 50s motel that has been turned into a very pleasant hotel. The room was very clean and the bathroom ,although small was nicely decorated and also clean. Beds very comfortable and good aircon (if needed).The pool is not large but perfectly adeqhate for a refreshing dip after a long 10 hour flight from the UK!Breakfast was fresh pastries and bagels etc with coffee, juice and fresh fruit- eaten near the pool or back in rooms.Nice relaxed area and we walked to Fisherman's Wharf via a park and along the side of the bay - you can also take a bus from nearby.I certainly would recommend this hotel.

Great for kids!! I recently traveled with my husband, 4 year old, 5 month old, and my mother. We stayed at the hotel's kids suite that includes a seperate room with a trundle bed and toys!!! It was great, especially for nap time. My mother was also able to stay in the room with my 4 year old, and we used a pack and play that the hotel provided for our 5 month old. I would suggest that you bring all your own linens for the pack and play. We also had the kitchenette, which was very small, but served its purpose.
