The breakfasts were great, and the staff very helpful. It was also great to have free parking...a real gem to find in SF!!

Lovely, Hip Hotel in Great In-Town Neighborhood My husband, 12 year old son, and I visited San Francisco on a long weekend the first part of October. We stayed at the Hotel del Sol, based on reviews that I had read on TripAdvisor. Well, let me say, that the reviews were right on the money! We loved the Hotel del Sol, and highly recommend it! It is located in a GREAT, safe, in-town neighborhood that is close to everything, but far enough away from the noise and tourist traps. It is located in the Marina district, which is home to great shops and restaurants....all that you can easily walk to. We loved to explore the different streets with the neighborhood restaurants...plenty of outdoor cafes and coffee shops. It is in an upscale, residential neighborhood that was alot of fun. The hotel staff was young, very helpful, and friendly. They gave us lots of great recommendations for restaurants, etc. The rooms were done in bright colors, just like it shows on the website. I don't think you could get a better value for the money in that location. We took the city bus (a stop is located just 2 short blocks away) everywhere. It's easy to get around in San Francisco without a car! One thing we did that was awesome was.....rent bikes from Blazing Saddles Bikes and bike across the Golden Gate Bridge to Saulsalito! What a fun day we had! You can take the ferry right back across the bay to San Francisco. It's a beautiful boat ride across the bay. We will definately return!

Wonderful hotel! Wow we loved this place! Super kid friendly, they loved it all especially the cookies and milk in the evenings. The rest of us loved the neighborhood, nice and quiet but still close to lots of great places to eat and shop. Union Street is two blocks away, the Marina district is a quick bus ride one way, North Beach the other way. Fisherman's wharf is pretty close, but not really worth it when you have so many other better places to see. W e loved just walking up and down the streets admiring the shops and houses. We will definitely be back!

Great Location, nice hotel We just got back from a ten day stay in San Francisco where we stayed at Hotel Del Sol and had a great time. The hotel isn't the most luxorious, but the rooms are really comfy and spotlessly clean and the staff were great. We were torn between staying near the touristy area of Fishermans Wharf and paying extra for the 'privilege' , or saving money by staying further out at H.D.S. After spending a couple of nights at H.D.S. and visiting Fishermans Wharf we were so happy we chose not to stay in the tourist area, it was so tacky and the restaurants we tried weren't that good, unless all you want to eat is chowder. Hotel Del Sol is in Cow Hollow and very close to Union St, which is a fantastic area full of small restaurants and bars mostly full of locals. Try and get to eat at least once at Beetelnut, be sure to make a reservation at least a day in advance as it's always packed and serves fabulous food. It's easy to get around with the public transport system so that wasn't a problem, a ten minute ride to Union Square and all the shopping. The breakfast is coffee, orange juice, cereal, bagels and pastries and you can eat out by the pool or take back to your room. On the whole I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Great stay in a great neighborhood This is a cheerful and comfortable place to stay. Yes, it's basically an updated motor inn, but the bright colors, the comfortable bed, the lovely plantings, and the great location really make it a cut above your average motel. Our room had a HUGE closet where we could store our suitcases and hang all our clothes. The bathroom was fine -- the usual low-flow shower, but everything was very clean. The staff was extremely helpful about recomending local restaurants or giving directions. The thing we loved best about the Hotel Del Sol was its location -- great shopping, restaurants, and parks were a short walk away, but it's basically in a very nice residential area that's very quiet at night. Throw in the free parking, and I think it's hard to go wrong with this place.

loved the bright collors We had a very pleasant stay. All rooms (and the elevator) are painted in bright colors. The furniture fits right in. I loved the window blinds. They lent us a baby crib (no charge). The best thing: they had a lot of games for young kids and videos you could borrow. The kids are still talking about the Dora game they played there.The bathroom was small, and no ventilation. But clean. The bed was short, wee tall people and our feet were sticking over the edge. The breakfast was very basic, not worth to write about. But the staff was very friendly and it was no problem to check in early when we came, and to get a late check out when we left.So overall, we can recommend this hotel.

Nice hotel in good area Spent three nights here in JulyAlthough it's basically a motel done up, it's got a certain charm, particularly if you like your colours bright.The hotel is kid friendly. We enjoyed NOT being right in the center of SF - having some outdoor space and pool (even though it is on the small side and right by the road ).Our kids particularly liked the evening milk and cookies. Two months later they're still talking about them!Location is also good for the Exploratorium (which is fantastic for kids) the delights of Union St and Chestnut St and a short ride to the cable car / Fisherman's wharf.You could pay more and get a nicer room somewhere more central, but Hotel del Sol is a great value place to be based

We loved Hotel Del Sol We had a great stay at Hotel Del Sol. At first I was disappointed with the room, it was nicely decorated but the hotel is definitely a motor lodge. Issues with ventilation, noise, etc. But I soon became smitten with the friendly staff  special touches: aveda skin products, friday afternoon reggae barbecue, palm trees lit at night with hammocks below, world music being pumped into the elevator, each room named (ours was the young  the restless), the courtyard with swimming pool  small grassy area...and the free parking didn't hurt either! The best part of Hotel Del Sol is the location: right in the heart of the marina between Union  Chestnut Street. We were travelling with our 2 year old son and he had a ball: there is an excellent neighborhood park right nearby, and we took him in his stroller all around the Marina, Chrissy Field, Fishermans Wharf.I would definitely recommend Hotel Del Sol.

Loved this hotel What a great family hotel! We stayed 2 nights and loved it.Friendly staff, nicely redone property in cheerful colors, complimentary breakfast, VCRs and videos for the kids, parking included - all nice amenities.There's even a small outdoor pool. We would definitely stay there again.

Great....again!! Whils visiting San Fran for the second time, my partner and i used the Del Sol for the second time.It really is a great place to stay.As other posts have said its in a safe area with plenty of resaurants within a short walking distance.The parking is free, a big plus in SF, the breakfast is nothing to write home about but as i have pointed out a short walk puts pay to that. As some posts have also said that it is just a motor lodge, and yes it is, but it has a charm of its own and being a old fifties style motor court only adds to that. We used the hotels recommendation of eating at The Brazen Head. Strange name... but great food!!.We intend to go back in 07 and will be staying here again.

Smelly, Noisy and Cramped If you don't mind...Moldy and smelly rooms..we saw the mold growing behind the bed and had to buy air freshenersNo adequate closet space or storage for suitcases or clothes. There were no bureaus in the roomNot being able to open the bathroom door because of the toilet's locationNo place to hang wet towels for a familyHearing conversations and footsteps all night and early morning from the stairwell and adjoining roomsHaving to request blankets returned and enough towels for the family 'suite' every eveningEating rock hard pastry and bagels for breakfastParking across the street because the free parking on sight could only accomodate half the guests......Go right ahead and stay here.

Wonderful location , great value This delightful hotel is one of those gems that we only found out about by using Trip Advisor.It is in a great location in the trendy Marina district. We felt rather smug when we saw other tourists paying through their noses to stay in the usual chain hotels in the Fishmen's Wharf area - we were where the trendy peole are and we were getting a great deal as well ! Our room was simple with bright soft furnishings but very clean. Our bathroom was perfectly adequate albeit a little small. Our children thought the milk and cookies at 7 a great idea even if they are teenagers and hadn't yet had supper !The continental breakfasts were fine - there are a limited number of tables around the pool and some guests did tend to hog them for longer than was appropriate either while waiting for other members of their party to surface or to simply sit at the table planning that days sightseeing. But that is a very minor gripe.The hotel is situated in a great area - there are plenty of nice bars and restaurants within a few blocks. We walked to Ghiardelli Square by day and back in the evening and felt completely safe throughout. From Little Italy and Chinatown there is a direct bus that goes right along Union Street to within a few blocks of the hotel which was very convenient..When we arrived we were in need of a laudry to get some clean clothes - the very pleasant and helpful front desk staff recommended a Chinese laundry close by that was wonderful.Don't expect fancy rooms and flash facilities but as a reasonably priced base from which to explore this wonderful city this hotel would be hard to beat. We arrived there from the over the top 5 star luxury of the Venetian Resort in Las Vegas and enjoyed our stay at the Hotel del Sol just as much.

Still maintaining its high standards This is a hot off the press review as we only left today! The hotel came as absolutely no surprise as it accurately reflected the high standards of the previous reviews. The only trouble with giving it rave reviews is that more of you folk will visit and make future reservations difficult to get. Actually, we have already made them and that is recommendation enough for the Hotel Del Sol. An even more credible recomendation is that the 3 teenage kids thought it was cool, how often do parents and kids agree about anything! Ok, stop procrastinating and book!

Loved it. Know what is important to you. Loved this hotel.It is a converted motor lodge right in the the thriving marina district. The small rooms have been re-done in bright colors. Open the windows on a great breeze flows in. The nieghborhood is great -- full of beautiful buildings and shops and AWAY from the main tourist locatiosn ( a plus for us). The pool is in shade all day, which didn't seem to bother the kids who splashed around in it all morning and evening.Good coffee and bagels in the morning (although why stay at the hotel for breakfast when so many great little places for eggs are right around the corner on Chestnust Street?) And in the evening, warm cookies and milk for families.We had a great sleep, nice time. Not much in terms of services but a GREAT FRIENDLY staff. What do they do to these guys? The happiest desk clerks ever. Good for families and chill couples.If you are uptight, stay away.

Perfect for Families Two nights at the Hotel del Sol was an enjoyable experience for our entire family (mother, father, daughter-14, son -12). The hotel staff was exceptionally accomodating and friendly. After the first night we requested to move to the 2nd floor due to the frolic of a 3 year old overhead, and were met with zero friction. The rooms are average size, brightly decorated and clean. The grounds have a fun, sunny feel to them. The pool is a nice bonus. We did not waste time lying around it but my son did enjoy swimming while my daughter and I walked to nearby shops. My family did give me an A+ on location. Although it is not central, it is in the trendy Marina Distict., a local that is chocked full of fantiastic neighborhood restaurants and bars. We love this feel so much more than tourist traps. If you go BE SURE to have a meal (or two) at The Grove corner of Chestnut and hmmmm...I forget., but believe me it is worth any research- Any local would know. Another favorite was Andele (same street as The Grove) Mexican Cantina. I do feel like the Hotel del Sol is a definate find!!

Golden Gate Greeter program a real winner with Hotel De Sol I had looked at trip advisor reviews prior to booking Hotel De Sol and booked directly through the hotel. The hotel was great, not flash, but very comfortable and offered everything my family of 5 needed to make our stay comfortable.The union street shops up the road had some lovely restuarants to eat at, and the bus was only a block away , which made travelling easy. Free parking for our car was a bonus, as was breakfast, as looking for a place to eat with 3 children is not fun early in the morning.The offer of a guded tour by a local through the Golden Gate Greeter program was the main reason I chose this chain of hotels and I am so please we took the opportunity. Our greeter, Bob, was a lovely person who gave frrely of his time and knowledge about San Franscisco. It was great having a local's insite into the city and having someone take us to the sites made it so much easier to get to them without the aggravation of finding our way around unfamiliar territory.I would highly recommend the hotel for htose that are happy to be a liitle out of 'downtown' and the Golden Gate Greeter is a must for any tourist! I only wish they were available in more places!Donna

Great with kids I took my 9 year old niece for a weekend in San Francisco and stayed at the Hotel del Sol. She had a fantastic time. They accomodated all her needs. She got to check out videos, books and games from their closet at the front desk. Her favorite part was the chocolate chip cookies in the afternoon. We hung out on the hammock and at the pool. I live nearby so I had chance to see my neighborhood as a visitor. It's a safe neighborhood with lots of amenties nearby and has a hotel with a good price. We will stay here again!

Great stay with the kids! Spent 3 nights with our 2 boys at the Del Sol in April. The room was nice and clean and had good storage with a separate closet. Bathroom was definitely tiny but very clean and functional, especially the shower. We enjoyed our stay at the Del Sol. The location is really great if you want to enjoy the upscale neighborhoods of Marina, Cow Hollow or Pacific Heights. There are many restaurants, bars, shops and playgrounds a short walk from the hotel. Being able to park the car for free in San Francisco is definitely a plus as most hotels charge $30 or more for parking. Breakfast was OK but don't expect too much. Same for service. No complaint overall, this is great value especially if you have a car and are travelling with children.

Very good hotel Stayed in a double double room at the Del Sol for 4 nights in April (2 adults and 2 children 11 and 13).The room and bathroom were very clean and tidy, the shower was good. There was a good walk-in wardrobe for storage and a safe. The beds were comfortable and the decor was groovy. The room was just a bit too small for 4 people and if your budget can stretch a suite or familly room would be worth it. It was also great to have a heated pool for the kids which was available to use from 8am to 10pm the kids did not need to be supervised and could seen from our bedroom window. The location was good, a 15-20 minute walk to Pier 39 or a $10 taxi ride for 4. There were restaurants near by and a post office just around the corner. If your lucky you could get parking within the court yard of the hotel, otherwise there is additional parking next to the hotel. You can walk along Lombard Street up a very steep hill to 'The Crookedest St' part and catch the cable cars (trolley) to the cable car museum and on to Union Square thus avoiding 30-60 minute queues at the terminus. It is worth getting a one day travel pass $11 per person which can be used on the cable cars, street cars and buses all day otherwise you pay as you get on an off. You can also get a 3 day pass.
A Very Nice        Bathroom, a bit small but perfectly fine

Location, location, location!! This is the best location to stay when visiting San Francisco. It's in between (2 blocks from both) Union Street and Chestnut Street with an abundance of shops, bars, and retaurants. It's located in a very safe residential neighborhood and gives the visitor a true taste of local living. You can easily visit all of the nearby attractions by walking or taking one of the many thousands of buses. This is not a great honeymoon hotel (the rooms are cute, but not elegant).

(Almost) Perfect Hidden Jewel This quirky, funky hotel was a great base for our week-long visit (Jan 15-21, 2006) to the city. Since it is actually a converted motel, parking is provided (at no addl. fee) to guests: a big plus in this city! Although the place is older (50s), it is well maintained. The decor is bright and airy. There are just over 50 rooms and I think that most of them overlook the courtyard (small pool, bistro tables, vending machines) Our room had two comfortable queen-size beds, a small table, two chairs, an entertainment center that held the TV and a VCR and had 4 small drawers, a large walk-in closet with a personal safe and a small bathroom (no bathtub.) There was an exposed ventilating fan above the shower stall. The fan was extremely dusty/grimy and looked like it had never been cleaned. The water pressure in the shower was the big disappointment to us. Honestly, it was so slight that it was difficult to rinse one's hair of the shampoo and conditioner. The heating/cooling unit ! is efficient and modern (although it was slightly loud.) One can see the daylight around the closed door of the room though since there are large gaps between the door and the frame. We were on the third floor; there were two staircases at either end of the floor. There is also an old, tiny elevator near the reception area. We were lucky to fit the two of us and our suitcases in the unit, and it moves slowly. We only used the elevator when we transported our luggage though. The staff is friendly and helpful. Although a continental breakfast is provided to all guests every morning, we wanted a full breakfast one day and one of the staff suggested a place within walking distance. It was great: good food, selection, portions, and prices!There were a couple of nights that were noisy (one can hear toilets flushing, doors closing, etc. on a regular basis but those noises fade into the background once you get used to them) because of some rowdy folks but, overall, the noise is ge! nerally contained. There are signs posted around the hotel that request that folks keep the noise down during the night. The location-in the marina section of SF-was convenient to shops, Pier 39, Fisherman's Wharf, public transportation, etc. This place is not the lap of luxury but it is wicked comfortable and very reasonably priced. I would return to the Hotel Del Sol if the price was right again (although I'd worry about rinsing my hair . . . )

Great Family Hotel We chose the Hotel del Sol because it was rated as the #1 family hotel in SF in a book we picked up @ BN. Although it was not perfect, the positives far outweighed the negatives.Negatives first. We stayed for a week in the family suite. There was no dresser to place our clothes, and the closet was tiny. So our clothes stayed in the suitcases. Second, they need a TV in the kid's room (the 5 of us fought over the only one located in the main room). Finally, they only had a shower in the bathroom...no tub. This made it difficult to keep our toddler clean, since he's used to baths and did NOT like the shower. All in all, no big deals with the negatives. Just suggestions for improvement.The del Sol is in a great location. We were there a week and never once used our car. The Exploratorium is an easy walk in one direction (northwest I think) and Fisherman's Wharf is an easy walk the other direction. There is a GREAT playground about 200 yards from the hotel. The area is safe and the people are friendly. If you need to go farther or just don't like to walk, the #30 bus, which has a stop about 50 yards from the hotel, goes just about everywhere in the city. Purchase the citypass (we did online before making the trip) and you can ride all the buses, trolleys, cable cars, etc. free for 7 days. SF is an incredible city, and the del Sol is a wonderful place to stay to enjoy it. We plan on many more visits in the future.

Funky, cute! My husband and I were just going to be in SF for 1 night on our way to a wedding so we just wanted something inexpensive. What a bargain! I got a room at one of the funkiest hotels I have ever seen. The color scheme is great, room was cozy. It was a little noisy since we were next to the stairs and on the street but who cares! The pool/courtyard was great. The free breakfast was decent. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. He pointed us to a great restaurant only a couple of blocks away. And have I mentioned that they have free parking. My Silverado wouldn't fit in the on site parking but they have a free lot across the street. We are definitely staying here on our next trip to SF.

Wonderful Place! I was incredibly impressed with this motel. The most comfortable bed I've ever slept on (manager even sent me the name of the company so I can buy one myself), fantastic colors, palms and bamboo, huge hammocks, aveda toiletries, handmade soaps, large walk-in closet, great desk area, a comfortable sitting area, nice art, terrific bathroom. No issue at all to get an extra (comfy) rollaway for our toddler. The cleaning team was the absolute best, adding more aveda daily and even folding our toddlers' blankie up with his bear on top. In fact, the entire staff was impressive. The cabana parking lot was terrific. Loved the view down from the balcony. and great coffee there all day. They gave our toddler a beach ball and sunglasses for the pool - he loved this place too, as did my husband. Cow Hollow is a beautiful residential urban neighborhood where we could walk to everything.Anything bad, anything?...ok, if only the muffins were homemade. That's about it.Honestly, I loved this place so much that I think every hotel owner/manager should be required to stay here every once in a while to understand how excellent a renovation can be and the value of an excellent staff.Before going to SF, it was a toss-up btwn here and Castle Inn, and I'm so glad we chose Hotel Del Sol. Just fantastic. They earned lifetime customers out of us, and I have a hard time imagining someone who wouldn't like this hotel. Can't wait to go back.

WE LOVED THE Del Sol!! Husband and I just spent 3/wonderful nights in San Fran at a great little find of a motel - the Hotel del Sol....this place is the best kept secret in San Fran! This is not a big fancy hotel, with big lobby, doorman and all that fancy overpriced stuff. This is an adorable colorful hotel I believe from the 1950's or 60's that was remodeled and the end result is simply breathtaking! You feel like you walked onto the set of Miami Vice in the tropics. So colorful, great hot colors of pinks, blues, yellows, pastel. Wonderful painted elevator, beautiful colorful tiled courtyard with beautiful trees, hammocks, fun heated pool. The rooms are very large, clean and again so bright and cheerful. Wicker furniture, soft down comforters and pillows. A walk-in closet with safe, great clean bathroom with good selection of shampoos and soaps. PLUS real ART and great photographs hanging on the walls. Also a vcr for your to rent any videos free of charge from the main lobby. All the rooms have great colorful tiles on the doors with the room numbers - so artsy and very colorful. Great little fruit treets on each of the floors outside the room. This place is so pretty - and just very special. The staff was wonderful and will do anything to make your trip worthwhile. The best is the FREE PARKING which is a miracle for San Fran. Wonderful breakfast in the morning too. Lot's of bagels, cheeses, jams, eggs, juices and coffee and the set-up is just very beautiful. Someone at this hotel must be an artist or someone very creative. Just really nice special touches all over this hotel!! The neighborhood is very nice too. Some of the best restaurants were found just a block in either direction. This motel is close to Lombard Street with the crooked street. Also Union Street is just like 2/blocks up with great sights to see and wonderful shops! I have been all over the world and I have to say this was a pleasant surprise to find a tiny little place like this with so many personal touches to it. If you go to San Fran. you have to stay here. From the free parking, to the wonderful art, landscape grounds with the pretty twinkle lights at night, nice breakfast and beach-style rooms you just can't ask for anything more! When you drive a short distance down to Fishermans Wharf and you see all the overcrowded, high price hotels and motels all crammed in together it really makes this place feel like you are home. It is that good! Hope this helps. You will not be disappointed with the Hotel del Sol. It is that special!

Great Place This hotel is great place to stay. Parking is free and also have covered parking under hotel. The rooms were clean,very clean! Excellent staff that also went out of their way.Excellent location ,easy access and access to the transit system just 2blocks. Whether you have a car or not its a great place.Heated pool is nice and its a very quite location. Hope you enjoy your stay we will be back soon.

Good family hotel We were in San Francisco as tourists for 3 nights at the Hotel Del Sol. You must accept it for what it is...an older motor inn given a fresh coat of paint. The paint is no longer so fresh, but the rooms are reasonably clean. It is a bargain for a family of 6 as we were...a two room suite (Queen bed plus a small bunk room), free breakfast (the same each day so we spiced it up with selections from local bakeries a short walk away) and a small pool. The location is great...in Cow Hollow just a short walk from trendy Union Street and a bit longer walk (but quite do-able) from Lombard Street, the Marina District, Fishermans Wharf and North Beach/Chinatown. Free parking is worth $20-30 in the city. It was in centrally located in the city but still fairly quiet at night and more of a neighborhood setting...they even loan (for free) videos of movies set in SF! One warning...SF in the summer can be quiet cool (60's) especially when the fog comes in and the wind blows (the only good view of the Golden Gate Bridge I had for 3 days in July was when driving over it!) so be prepared with a light jacket or fleece and long pants! The irony of the Hotel del Sol was that in July is was not very sunny there!

Fun, Fab Location, Attentive Staff, Free Park, cool decor we just returned from this hotel - after a conference went here for a one night to see the city. I had searched and searched and as an avid traveller as well as extreme bargain hunter I was very happy to find this hotel.This is a funky older hotel from the 1950's that a lovely (I am sure gay, not that there's anything wrong with that) group of folks totally rennovated. As to the room basics it follows the standard 50's motor court shape, with doors and windows facing a center courtyard, small pool, and parking underneath (FREE parking, as compared to some hotels that charge $20 to $40/night). The bathroom was very 50's, tile, small and shower. The rooms are 50's motor court size, which was fine for myself and child in two beds. Nice bright accents, paint and accessories have been added to give it a cute and modern feel without sacrificing its retro cool. Great art, furniture and bedding give it a warm, mod feel. Staff was exceptional - very friendly and helpful with directions, etc. And you even get a free continental breakfast - note there are no coffee makers in the room which is fine with the included breakfast. also lots of towels, upscale toiletries and a FREE video library featuring movies made in San Francisco. And the pool was heated but it was too cold outside to use. a bit about the neighborhood, this is an area called Cow Hollow that is a good area, and there are restaurants and a nice shopping area on Union street close by. Its a great urban spot with upscale folks and their associated local grocery stores, hamburger shops and yoga studios. Convenient to Fishermans wharf (do not walk, drive or take public transport) - close to the Marina district, golden gate bridge, crissy field, and the presidio and not far from north beach, chinatown and market street. thanks to the staff - perfect price, perfect spot. we will DEFINATELY be back. A bright spot in an area with vanilla accomodations

Very Pleased! PROS: friendly staff, clean rooms, quaint setting, convenient location to Marina District's attractions(residential setting, cafes, lively corner bars, restaurants, etc.), 25 min walk through Fort Mason coastal park to Fisherman's Wharf, good parking.CONS: a bit expensive for the accommodations, but then again, this is San Francisco.Whenever I return to SFO, I will certainly book a room at Hotel Del Sol.

We'll Be Back We only spent 1 night at Hotel Del Sol. The neighborhood is residental but only a short walk to shops and restaurants and very close to buses. It's a very nice area. It's a renovated motel, and it's very colorful and bright and cheery. Our room was located in the stairwell and facing the street, so it was noisy at times. Not during the night, however, so we slept just fine. Our room was on the small size, but completely fine. Decoration was colorful but tired. Showerhead was faulty and sprayed water all over bathroom, and drain was clogged. Fun, handmade soaps and nice Aveda products in bathroom. Parking is on site and free. Overall, a good hotel which we would definitely return to. If you're looking for luxury accomodations, this is not the place, but it is clean and safe and convenient, at a great rate.

A gem of a motel We stayed at the Del Sol in August 2004,having read a really glowing review in the UK's Daily Telegraph.We were not disappointed.Its a great little motel in an excellent location with very friendly and helpful staff.The rooms are relatively basic,although clean,spacious with quirky decor.The free and substantial parking facilities are a real benefit,yet the location of the motel means that most of San Francisco's main spots such as Union Square,Fishermans Wharf are easily accessible on foot.....even taking into account the hills.We would thoroughly recommend the Del Sol.Its not posh,but represents great value.In fact,considering its San Francisco location,a little gem of a place and offering much better value and character than the chain establishments on or near Fishermans Wharf,where we have stayed before.

A Fun Colorful Atmosphere Hotel Del Sol is a fun, relaxing, colorful place. You're surrounded with bright tropical colors and hammocks attached to palm trees await you. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The staff is very friendly, knowledgable, and always greet you with a smile. The location is great, it's away from the busy part of SF, yet close to great shopping on Union, the Palace of Fine Arts, and the Marina. I strongly recommend Hotel Del Sol to everyone, including families.
Une trs bonne adresse pour des familles   showReview(19547066, 'full');
Wirklich sehr sehr schn!!   showReview(17340030, 'full');
Plutot Decu....   showReview(15632448, 'full');
superbe htel   showReview(13550486, 'full');

Wonderful staff at the front desk, but not optimally clean and noisy. I stayed for a conference trusting the fact that it is related to the Hilton line. The people at the front desk were wonderful, polite, helpful, really nice consistently. My trip back to the airport was a breeze since they arranged everything on time, with a good company. The furniture is nice and practical, but the hallways smelled terrible. The rooms were not cleaned optimally and inconsistently things like soap, coffee etc were replaced. The room has a small kitchen and all the appropriate appliances, which I think it is a plus, but the room itself is somewhat crowded.The room is on top of a busy highway that would not stop all night long. I could not sleep at peace.

Free Everything! This hotel is fantastic. I should stress that I have never stayed at a Homewood Suites before so I didn't know that they included so much in the base rate, but we were blown away. Among the things that this place provided for free were 'light dinner' (which could really suffice as dinner i.e. meatloaf, lasagne etc), alcoholic drinks every night we were there (Mon-Thurs), free hot breakfast, free in-room internet and a free shuttle to major sites. We were upgraded to a suite which was very roomy and had a great kitchen. It was a very nice room. The only negatives with the hotel were that the comforter/doona was scratchy (as a previous reviewer noted), and that the business centre broke and despite assurances of it will be fixed in two/three hours, it never was. Everything else about this hotel was excellent. The location is right near downtown - it's only a 5 minute walk (maximum) to the heart of downtown Seattle, and only 10 minutes or so to Pike Place Market. We walked basically everywhere, including to the Seattle Centre, the wharf to get the Bainbridge Island Ferry, and to Pioneer Square from this hotel. We only had to get a bus when we went to Fremont.I would definitely recommend the Homewood Suites Hilton for Seattle. What a great place!

Good location and value Stayed here on Dec 2, 2008. Very nice property in downtown. Room was a little tight, but it was just me. If I was travelling with spouse or kids the room would have been small. They also offer a free dinner and breakfast. I skipped the dinner and hit the Cheesecake factory a few blocks away. Hotel is right next to the convention center. Fitness center is very nice. Very clean and newer equipment.
Good location and value for money       View 2

Updated Hotel and Comfortable stay I've had a fantastic experience at the hotel now named Homewood suites. My room is newly remodeled with flat screen tvs in the bed room and living room. Granite counter tops in the kitchen and bathroom, as well as a spa tub. I also have a balcony. Its a great escape from the busy Seattle hustle and bustle outside. They also serve a complementary breakfast and welcome home light dinner. I love it! and wish I could stay longer!! I have heard some construction and see it in the lobby, but its not disrupted my stay at all.

Cute hotel, some construction, but comfortable and great value! The boyfriend and i stayed in this unique place due to him being in Seattle for business. It was a great location due to it being a bit off the beaten path from the business of the city yet close enough to walk everywhere I wanted to go. The rooms are incredibly large and for the price that we paid, we felt that we got a great bang for our buck! The comforter on the bed was really scratchy, and the front entrance to the hotel was under contstruction, but other than that, I would definitely reccomend this place to my friends and other travelers.

Great value, comfortable hotel Pike Street Suites is a hotel of excellent value, conveniently located, spacious, with many comforts. My husband and I chose this hotel on a 3-day weekend for its location and low price (we paid $119 + tax on Expedia for a 1-br king suite). It had been recommended by my sister. The suite was large, very clean and true to the advertised floor plan. Contemporary furnishings, two plasma TVs, decent lighting, free wireless internet, and free local phone calls. We only used the refrigerator and microwave, but there was a full kitchen for meal preparation. The bed was very comfy, with crisp, quality linens, comfy pillows and excellent mattress. I particularly appreciated the blackout window shades. I did not hear any freeway or road noise from our courtyard-view room, and I am typically a light sleeper. We also enjoyed the medium sized private balcony, which overlooked cherry trees blossoming in the courtyard.The bathroom is average+. Marble counter and contemporary fixtures, but only an average sized tub and vanity area. Nothing terribly fancy, but perfectly clean. The workout room is small but has all the equipment I wanted. It was warm enough to enjoy the heated outdoor pool and jacuzzi, which were cozy but quite nice. There is also an indoor jacuzzi. The hotel is a short walk (uphill!) from the convention center and downtown shopping. Last fall, we stayed at the Grand Hyatt, which is about 3 blocks away. While the Grand Hyatt is elegant and more luxurious, we had much more space at Pike Street Suites at about half to 1/3 the price. The lobby is still undergoing renovations, but we were not bothered by construction noise. Breakfast-in-a-bag was available, but we did not try it. A conversion to Homewood Suites is expected for later this spring. Hopefully, the hotel will retain its charms.

Wicked value for the price! Close to the conference centre. A bit noisy as you overlook a free/highway. Breakfast buffet is exceptional! Good shopping/restaurants nearby. Rooms are old and dusty, and windows don't close easily (I had to switch rooms). Gym is small but doable.

Nice Renovations; Bed Type Issues Booked through Expedia, which guaranteed a King Bed. Because I'm wary of such promises when I didn't book direct with the hotel, I called the day of arrival to reconfirm a non-smoking King. The desk agent reconfirmed the bed type, so I felt confident about getting what we were promised.At check it, I saw that the Registration Card also stated Nonsmoking King, so I didn't reconfirm it with the desk clerk - I thought that would be overkill.We found our room - the halls are definitely taking some wear and tear from the renovations, but the room was beautiful - hardwood floors, well-appointed kitchenette, beautiful large bathroom, very comfortable modern sofa and a queen sized bed!We didn't notice the size of the bed until after we were completely unpacked (we were staying four nights), so didn't feel like re-packing and moving, so we didn't ask management to correct the situation. But it was mildly annoying to have taken so much effort, even on the day of arrival, and to have our promised bed type switched out from under us at check in.Otherwise, the stay was nice - good breakfast in the lobby each morning, with hot options in addition to cold. And it was very nice to have the kitchen - we were able to make hot tea and chocolate every afternoon after cold days in Seattle's December weather.We usually stay here because of the excellent location between downtown and first hill. We can generally walk anywhere, and we very much enjoy that.On the day of departure we called to see if the hotel shuttle was available to take us to the train station - I had asked the day before and was told they didn't take reservations and it was on a first come, first served basis. I was told that the van had just left in the opposite direction and wouldn't be back for at least 45 minutes, so we took a cab instead. After checking our luggage at the train station, we walked a block to a coffee shop and were passed on the street by the hotel shuttle!Having stayed here regularly for the last 8 years or so, I must say that the details have usually been handled better than during this stay. These little blips weren't enough to make me move to another hotel, but repeats of the same will definitely make me think about it, if I see similar issues in the future.

A very pleasant stay Its undergoing renovations or rebranding, but construction was going on when I was there a couple of days ago.But its not obtrusive.Room was very pleasant, there is a working kitchen and its in downtown seattle near the public trpt system and some attractions.Staff were pleasant enough and helped me out with directions and such, so cant complain.A pleasant experience, highly recommended.

A great place to stay! Our family of five stayed in a beautiful 1 bdrm suite Dec. 23 - 26th. The suites are newly renovated and you can tell as soon as you walk in, everything looks and smells new! My husband and I slept in the very spacious bedroom with a comfy King sized bed with all white bedding and fluffy duvet, similar to the Westin's Heavenly Beds. It had a flat screen TV on the dresser and nice modern furnishings. The 3 boys slept in the living area - 2 on the sleeper sofa and 1 on a roll-away and they still had plenty of space. They really liked watching movies on the large flat screen TV mounted to the wall. The suite also has a kitchen with everything you need to make a meal. The bathroom was large and very nice with a really cool sink and fancy tap. There was also a gas f/p which was really nice to have being Christmas so I was able to lay out the stockings by it like we do at home. I also brought a small xmas tree that sat nicely on top of a cabinet next to the f/p. It was lovely. The boys had alot of fun in the outdoor heated pool and I really enjoyed sitting in the outdoor hot tub sipping hot tea in the cool air. They also have an indoor hot tub and a fitness room which was sufficient for my husband and I to have a quick work out. The breakfast which is included was pretty good, the boys ate lots of their favorite Cinnamon Toast Crunch cereal and waffles. They also have eggs and sausage, oatmeal, bagels, toast, fruit, yogurt, juice and coffee.The location can't be beat, close to restaurants (Cheesecake Factory just down the street), movie theatres, and shopping of course. There's lots of free parking around the area as well.Customer service was great helping us find restaurants that were open on Christmas Eve and Christmas Day, and they were prompt with our request for towels and toiletries.The only negative thing was the outside of the hotel and small, unattractive lobby area, where it's very evident that there are renovations going on, although we never heard any noise. We would definitely stay here again! Hopefully the prices won't go up too much when it becomes the Homewood Suites by Hilton in the Spring.....

Great value, good location, friendly staff We stayed at the Pike Street Suites during the last week of November. This was my 3rd visit in the last year and I have been impressed each time. Our family was traveling to Seattle for a mini vacation and shopping trip and since we prefer to each have a little bit of our own space, I contacted the hotel directly to see what options we had. Based on their recommendations we reserved the Junior Suite adjoining the King Standard. The Junior Suite had a living room, kitchen and separate bedroom which adjoined a regular room with a king bed. This turned out to be a great idea and a wonderful deal. Lots of room and a small kitchen where we prepared dinner a couple of nights.Each morning we went to the complimentary breakfast off the lobby which had whole fruit, yogurt, pastries, cereal, juice, eggs, sausage and coffee. All fresh and breakfast room was bright and clean. We did miss the fresh waffles they used to serve though!The hotel is close enough to Pike Market, a number of shopping malls, movie theaters and restaurants that we only used our vehicle once during our stay. Easy walk to catch the Monorail to the Seattle Center (Space Needle, Sci-Fi Museum and others).Front Desk and Housekeeping were friendly and competent. I would like say thanks to Britt, Sara and Dan who were especially helpful.All in all, we had a great time in Seattle and were very pleased with the hotel.Highly recommended!

Like it a lot, but the customer service needs some improvements We stayed at this hotel for 4 days at the end of December in the 1 bedroom . I compared the rooms to a Best Western we stayed at and the rooms were not that big but nicely newly decorated. The breakfast was more than we expected, eggs, sausages, pastries, and the usual stuff. The outdoor pool was very warm and kids had lost of fun. The bathroom fan in our room was very loud, the front desk person that was a male but tried to talked like a girl was not helpful at all with our questions about how to get around and where the hotel shuttle can take us. Fortunately for him his coworker came around and help. She had answered our question very quickly.We were not willing to pay $24 for hotel parking so we parked outside which was cheaper as between 6pm to 8am the parking is free. The location is great- walking to all downtown shops and market, very close to cheesecake factory- our new favorite place to eat.We will stay here again.

Fantastic place to stay This was the perfect hotel for a family. The rooms are enormous, we had a spectacular view of the space needle and downtown Macy's where they set off fireworks to kick off the holiday shopping season. The location was great, right between downtown (for shopping and touring) and Capitol Hill (for exceptional reasonable restaurants). Breakfast was great, very substantial, lots of choices, and fresh fruit. The staff was super helpful from the front desk to the bellmen to the engineer and housekeeping staff. The sleeper sofa was a bit beat but they are in the process of renovating and the room was actually big enough that we just took the mattress off the frame and put it on the floor for our kid.

Nice place to stay - Rude Shuttle Driver I stayed at this hotel during the Marine Expo Convention for 5 days. The room was nice and bed was comfortable. This hotel is walking distance to every thing Pike street has to offer. My only complaint is with the Hotel courtesy driver. I am not sure how this guy has managed to keep this job, his service was terrible, he was rude each time we used the shuttle service - basically he acted like he was pissed off that we asked him to give us a ride. (This is the day driver, not sure how the night driver is). I tipped him a minimum of 5 dollars for a short ride and he would perk up and be nice for about 5 seconds, the next ride would start all over with the pissed off attitude. He need's to work on his people skills. Maybe he need's to just quit this job and get a job at some remote location so he can be by himself each and everyday.

Part of a really great anniversary 10/27/07! Prompt and free shuttle service from the train station to the hotel and back the next day, plus the same service to Pike Place Market! The staff was genuinely friendly, not just courteous. Our room was super nice. We had a king-sized bed, living room area, kitchen, double-sinks in the bathroom  a whirlpool tub. Plus 2 flat screen tv's.The only minor complaints we had were (1) the door to the room wasn't light proof so there was a lot of light spilling in from the hallway. This was remedied by shutting the bedroom door. (2) the hallway noise from other customers was excessive. Some sound-proofing in the hallways walls would be great.Otherwise, it was a surprisingly fantastic place to stay! And the location let us walk to all kinds of places including the Paramount Theater where we saw Spamalot and to dinner.

Great Surprise-Great Hotel Wow. This was a great hotel. We booked a suite and got a huge one bedroom suite that was just renovated with all new furniture, carpet, granite counters and flat screen TV's. Free internet and breakfast too. Great deal. We will be back and recommend this hotel for sure!

Smoky and dirty - but good location We (my friend and I are women in our mid-30's) wanted to have a weekend girls shopping trip, so we booked this hotel through Hotwire. It said 31/2 stars, but this place was divey! It is near the convention centre, downtown shopping and although it's called Pike Street Suites, the famous Pike Street Market was nowhere in sight.The lobby was worn and dated. The front desk staff were inconsistent - some friendly, some rude, none of them very classy, no uniforms, just a bit odd. The first room that we were given was sick! It reeked of smoke and had an ash tray on the tv, even though we'd asked for non-smoking. There was a de-humidifier blasting, it was tiny and the carpet was quite stained (think CSI miami before the cleaning crew).We went down and complained and she upgraded us to a suite. This room was amazing. Much cleaner, a big bathroom, seperate bedroom and living area. We had only paid $109 on hotwire, so I don't know what this type of room would normally go for - but it was very adequate. No view (well, back alley or highway) and mid construction - although it wasn't loud. Overall, I wouldn't recommend this hotel because they tried to give us a sick room and if we hadn't complained our trip would have been lousy. However if you can get a suite, the location is good and the free brekfast had a lot of selection.

Good Value I thought this hotel was a good value for the money since we got a room upgrade to a suite due to over booking. Very close to downtown with a nice filling, full breakfast included in the price. The construction was not a problem at all, we noticed no noise.My complaint, is that the pool/hot tub chemicals must have been out of balance because I ended up with chemical burns so I do think they must get that one under control.Staff did not appear overly friendly and there were broken items such as entertainment unit cabinet door track and other minor details. We did not mention these things to staff being in a hurry but the value is there if these are corrected.

Currently Under Renovation... Pike Place Suites is currently in major remodel mode. Be prepared to expect construction noise during the day and some minor inconveniences. None the less, we had a nice stay in a new contemporary room. The room was not without glitches, all having to do with the remodel. No (wired) internet service yet, the sofa sleeper was still wired shut from shipping, one phone was improperly connected and not yet functional,... The engineering staff was pleasant  quick to remedy problems. Desk staff was couteous and helpful. Typical hotel free breakfast fare.Valet staff was NOT particularly helpful. BEWARE of the parking garage; it is meant for small vehicles only (as attested by the scrapes on the wall)!!!Further BEWARE of the shuttle driver, LLoyd; so very accommodating one day, mean  nasty the next. Pike Place Suites is close to everything---avoid the shuttle!After reading reviews, I requested a room on the quiet side of the hotel. Due to the renovation, that request was not granted. I was very pleased that turned out to be the case. Though I-5 almost immediately fronts the hotel our room was acceptably quiet with windows closed plus the city view was great!
fantastic stay       lobby

Disappointments galore. This property is drastically understaffed. The room was acceptable, but that was about it. I felt sorry for every employee there. On a busy weekend with several Mariner's games, I expected more than one front desk person, one guy running his tail off to get everyone's car, because the free shuttle to the ballpark was so crowded you couldn't on it. I will never stay there again.

Good value Stayed here for a week while attending a convention. Really convenient to the convention center and downtown in general. My suite (#523) was a little tired eg. carpet and sofa need replacing; but the bed was comfortable and the room was clean - although I did need to ask for an extreme vacuuming. Staff were friendly and the overall service was good. Room was quiet, which is often really hard to find. Not the cheapest place to stay, but good value for downtown Seattle. Kitchenette a definite plus. I would stay there again and recommend without hesitation.

Some Pros and Cons The staff are very friendly but we had a bad experience at check-in that colored our stay. We were put in what was clearly a smoking room (based on the smell) despite having requested NS in advance and confirming it at check-in. The room was also poorly cleaned. We were preoccupied with our young children thus it took us 2 days to change rooms. Once we did, we were much happier. The housekeeping was still just OK, but the rooms are a nice size with a good layout. We generally are not very picky so it was disappointing to have our stay get off to a bad start. One person on the staff tried to tell us that the first room was NS but it was clearly on the one smoking floor (the 3rd). The breakfast was nice and the location convenient. The parking is valet only so tipping is involved but cars are delivered very quickly. There is a fair amount of street noise from traffic and pedestrians. If you're planning to walk places, note that the walk back from the Pike Place Market is a steep climb; however there is a free bus and the hotel has a shuttle.

Loved it Just have two rooms is such a luxury. It's really convenient to the convention center, it's great to have access to a refrigerator and stove. The all day and night tea and coffee is very nice. It had an above average fitness center with weights, recumbent bike, elliptical trainer, and two treadmills. Great breakfast, though I wish all breakfasts in general at all hotels ran until 11. I'd love to stay there again next time I'm in Seattle.

Best experience ever in Seattle!!! I have stayed in several places in Seattle over the past couple years, and Pike Street Suites gave me the most friendly, courteous, enjoyable stay I have ever experienced!!! I am not a businesswoman, I am an ordinary mom who needed a nice night out. We were treated SO wonderfully by EVERYONE at this hotel, from the minute I made reservations, to the time we left. The suite was beautiful, everything was in place (including the Do Not Disturb sign, which was not in my room in the previous three places I stayed). The night I checked in, they were under-staffed for some reason, but the lady at the front desk handled it beautifully under pressure of handling incoming guests. Always with a smile, ever so courteous. This hotel has earned my loyalty!! (Just a heads-up though, if you choose not to use the valet parking service, you will need to walk up/down the ramps in the parking garage to access the hotel. There is no elevator in the garage).

Poor service I stayed here while attending the Seattle Gift Show in January. The location is great: only 5 minutes away and the hotel was recently renovated which is nice.But the service is mediocre. I can tell when staff are miserable with their jobs and this is one of those places. As an example that ticks me off to this day -- and motivated me to write my first ever review -- they have yet to respond to a question about my phone bill. The front desk told me someone would get back to me (they didn't), and I have phoned THREE TIMES and have been told three times someone will get back to me. They never did.They won't get a penny from me the next time I'm in town.

Family Friendly! Great rooms, Great location, Great Breakfast. Was an ideal hotel for our family (1 yr, 3yr and 4yr olds). We had our crib in thew bedroom and both kids on the sofa sleeper in the livingroom. Nice to put the baby down for her nap and be able to play with the other kids, make a snack and have access to the restroom without disturbing the baby. Traveling with kids- the full kitchen was a blessing!

Good Location and Value This hotel has changed hands, it's currently known as the Pike Street Suites, which looks to be an independent operation and a temporary situation until this summer. To paraphrase a note in the elevator, Hyatt is not in the picture, and Hilton will take over after a remodel that's supposed to be completed sometime this summer. It will then be part of their Homewood Suites chain.Their ownership situation has not affected this hotel negatively in the slightest. We found everyone at the front desk staff to be friendly and helpful. I requested a high floor and early check in and got both. I asked them for help in getting to the airport for a very early flight (we came in on Amtrak and flew back), and they arranged everything, and got me the best deal.We got a one room suite on the 8th floor, facing the courtyard. The room was very quiet, if you're nervous about road noise from I-5 (which really isn't that bad, IMO), then request the courtyard view. The property must have been apartments or condos at some point, the sound insulation was really pretty good.The room did show its age a bit, but wasn't bad. There was plenty of room, and the beds were comfortable. The kitchen had a fridge, stove, and microwave, and was stocked with plates, utensils, and glasses, which we did use a couple times.The continental breakfast in the morning is adequate, with the usual suspects available like fresh fruit, cereals, pastries, etc. Runs until 9:30am.The exercise room was decent, with 2 True treadmills, an elliptical machine, a recumbent stationary bike, and free weights. Also a TV, hot tub and heated pool.I did a lot of research before booking this hotel, and I believe it's the best deal downtown (we paid $130/night booking on the hotel website). It's two blocks to the convention center, and close to shopping. Also about a 10 minute walk to Pike Place Market, and less to some of the popular shopping areas like Pacific Place, Nordstrom's, Westlake Center, and the like. It's a few more minutes to the Pioneer Square area, but still not a bad walk. The hotel has a courtesy shuttle that can take you there if you ask.You can spend $100-$200 more per night to be a couple minutes closer to some of these things, you can decide if you think it's worth it, but we sure didn't. Maybe if you're on the company dime.Our only gripe has to do with the vagrant/homeless situation downtown. If you're from a bigger city, seeing these people around isn't a big surprise. But they seemed to be on about every other corner downtown and tend to be a bit more aggressive asking for money compared to some other cities. It's almost to the point where you hope the Walk sign is on when you cross intersections so you don't have to stop and be subjected to another in-your-face request for money. If you're okay giving change to them, more power to you. Otherwise just ignore them and they'll usually go away.

Now Pike Street Suites; will change name in summer 2007 again As of Jan 1, 2007 it is no longer a Hyatt chain hotel and is called the Pike Street Suites; the sign in the elevator says it will undergo renovations and then be renamed as Homestead suites (I think) as part of the Hilton chain. The sign says the staff and managment will remian the same.The staff were friendly and accomodating. I had one of the rooms overlooking the freeway so there was street noise but just a background level not honking horns.DIfferent rooms have different floor plans. I had a 1 bedroom suite and it has a kitchenette complete with dishwasher and dishes. It felt very roomy. The fold-out couch bed was adequate, not too uncomfortable. Great breakfast; quiet rooms (thick walls and floors).

Great location, staff, beds, so-so rooms Stayed here for the location. Which is excellent. Next door to convention center, around the corner from Pacific Plaza mall. 10 short blocks to Pikes Place, 5 to Capitol Hill. The room I ended up with was extremely small, I was alone so it worked out, if there would have been two of us it would have been challenging. The room was on the 8th floor facing the court yard which made for no noise but was interesting to see the other high rise residentials surrounding the courtyard, we could all look into each others windows, kind of disturbing and at the same time intriquing, I had to remind myself not to be rude and watch people eat or watch TV.The hotel is undergoing a name change and will be undergoing severe renovations which are much needed since it is in an upscale area, of course hwne they get done it will probably double the price of about $100 which I paid. scedule is to be done by summer of 2007.I would definately stay here again but probably spring for the suite rather than the standard room. Also parking is $21/day, kind of steep, but the internet was free, and even if it wasnt there were enough unsecure WIFI networks in the area to not worry about it if they did charge.A decent experience overall, now that I know what to expect.

Nice place, nice location, very pleased. The hotel has a nice location, walking distance to plenty of food options, movie theaters, malls, etc. My room was clean and had a couch, kitchen, and king size bed. The internet was free (yea!). Staff were nice, and the breakfast is they typical free stuff at extended stay places. reheated eggs, waffles, fruit, etc. It was fine with me. I did not encounter dirt or excessive noise as some of these reviews have mentioned. The road noise I did hear was acceptable for staying in the city. Warning to all country folk: In the city you will hear road noise! Go back to the suburbs if that is a problem for you.I bought off hotwire; $75 per night for 3 nights. Best of luck in your travels.
Formerly Summerfield Suites Wyndham Room was small. Needed cleaning. Garbage on floor. Dirty table top. Bathroom floor needed cleaning. That being said, the property has a great location.

Great home base for Seattle sighseeing!! My Husband and I spent a long weekend at the Summerfield suites before an Alaska cruise. The hotel was a steal at 80.00 a night. (Hotwire) The hotel is with in walking to pikes market and the space needle. We did use the free hotel shuttle to bring us to the waterfront for dinner. The drive staff were very friendly and got a great tip for dinner!! Elliott oyster bar, one of the best meals I have ever had!! The free breakfast was great!! All in All my stay in Seattle at the Summerfield suites was great!! Clean rooms, great views of the space needle and a friendly, helpful staff!! Would stay again in a heartbeat!!

Some good and some bad.... The good:Location, 10 blocks to Pike Place Market.Shuttle service that takes you to visitor locations.Close to shopping and lots of eating establishments.Huge rooms, we had a one bedroom suite with a full kitchen. A door that opened to small concrete patio.Great breafast buffet which included cheese omelets, sausage, make your own waffle, cereal, milk. fruit, juice, pastries, yogurt, oatmeal. Next door to the convention center.Comfy bed and clean bathroom.The bad:My reservation said we had a room with a jetted tub and when I inquired why we didn't have one they said they only had so many. It was the primary reason I chose this hotel over several others in downtown Seattle. Why have that as an option on the reservation if they can't deliver? I made the reservation two month prior at the hotel websiteWe also requested a quiet room. We were on the fourth floor facing Boren street. It is a hill so you are not really four floors above the traffic. The windows are not insulated and the traffic noise was horrible! If you are a sound sleeper or used to that type of thing it may not be a problem. Be sure to request a room that faces the inner courtyard where they have their outdoor pool. The rooms are showing some wear but I wouldn't put them in the shabby category yet. There was mold on the door track of the outside patio.
Great location for a great price       Sunset along the Pier 5

Great Stay! The hotel is in a great location. Walk straight down Pike Street about 10 blocks to the Pike's Place Market. There are some great restaurants right around the hotel. It's a quieter park of downtown, although really close to the expressway. Our room wasn't clean when we checked in and they gave us a new room with an up-grade! Really nice staff and helpful. As a whole the place is nice and clean. Great breakfast! Would definitel stay here again. Oh, and we had a perfect veiw of Spaceneedlle from our room! Great place.

Great place! You'll enjoy your stay here. Seattle being a place you really want to park your car and walk or take mass transit - you'll find this hotel well situated. Just walk down the street to Pike's Market. Easy access to the monorail to the Space Needle or a number of places to visit. A suite can be pretty nice after several days on the road. Great breakfast - the breakfast room is a little small, but you can always take what you want up to your room. Pool very enjoyable and the hot tub too -its outdoor. Staff very friendly and helpful. Parking at the hotel, about $20 a night. Excellent beds. Very much enjoyed our stay here and would definitely stay again.

Good deal, try Hotline I have stayed at the Summerfield Suites on Pike Street in Seattle several times in the past two years, always on a Hotline buy for about $75 per night --- a very good deal at that price. Minifridge, microwave (sometimes), small rooms but certainly adequate for two people. Ask for a quiet room as the hotel is on and over some very noisy streets and freeways. Excellent free breakfast ... hot make-yourself waffles, good variety of fruit, variety of cereal, eggs, sausage, etc. Very available free van for trips downtown and nearby --- good deal for a tip of a few dollars. Parking is $20 per night --- figure it into your cost if you have a vehicle. Every time I have stayed here there was loud noise from the central air conditioning unit --- staff always came quickly to turn it off --- you seldom need AC in Seattle anyway. Hotel staff is very helpful. Decent hotels in downtown Seattle are seldom under $100 --- this is a very good deal if you can get it in that price range.

Not a good move... From the time I booked my reservation (12/05) to the time I stayed at this hotel (4/20/06), it had changed ownership from Wyndham to Hyatt.I chose this particular hotel because I was going to a business conference at the WA Convention Center which is only a block away.I do like the fact that for a reasonable price, one can get a room with a kitchenette. I usually stayed at this hotel due to its location and the fact that Wyndham would ensure that I would get the room I asked for. Not so after the change to Hyatt. I specified in my reservation that I wanted a room away from elevators and vending machines. I also called the hotel directly a week beforehand specifying my request. The clerk advised me that they cannot guarrantee room placement under Hyatt but she would assign me a room just this once since I had made my reservation with a non-refundable payment in full under Wyndham. I also left work early to check in as soon as rooms were available so that I could get a quiet room to work. When I got to my room I found was next to the elevators on one side and the stairs on the other side. It was extremely noisy. I was told that there was no other room available, even though I had arrived 15 minutes before check in time. Everyone was polite and very sorry but that doesn't cut it when one hears stairway and elevator traffic all night and has to work the next day. It was very frustrating.In general, things were not as well attended to as they were when Wyndham ran things.For example, the light in my room did not work. Wyndham always makes sure that room fixtures do not fall into disrepair. The room coffee was tasteless.When I got to my roon around 4PM, there was a scattered array of breakfast dishes lining the hallway. In my years of staying at Wyndham hotels, they have not left dishes lying about the hall all day. Continental breakfast is the usual caloric cocktail of mini-muffins, microscopic danish and other combinations of air, starch, crystallline sugar and chemicals. Sadly, Seattle Summerfield Suites are sliding down the slope....in their new capacity of Hyatt Pull Toy.How disappointing that a once quiet, accommodating and well run-hotel is no more.

Great Stay I had a great one night stay at this hotel. The rooms were immaculate and the staff was very professional. The room had a small fridge and free internet access.I really enjoyed the breakfast buffet which consisted of fruit, cereal, oatmeal, juice (orange, apple, grapefruit), boiled eggs, waffles (made with a waffle-maker not toasted), toast, muffins, English muffins, bagels and cream cheese, yoghurt, coffee, tea, and probably a few other things I have forgotten. The free shuttle is great too. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Nice hotel and good location I stayed at the Summerfield Suites for 2 nights over the Easter long weekend, April 14-16. We made this reservation on hotwire. Check-in was quick. There was a business competition next door at the convention center so there were many high schoolers at the hotel walking around. We were given a room on the 8th floor, close to the elevator. When we opened the door, there was someone in the room so we walked back to the reception desk and asked for another room. The check-in clerk saw that he made a mistake so he gave us a suite on the 8th floor. The suite was big with a full kitchen, living room, a separate bedroom and full bathroom. A very good trade for the small inconvenience.Everything in the suite was clean, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was spotless. They now have toiletries with Hyatt on it. There is a workout room with hot tub and outdoor swimming pool on the 5th floor. They don't have a business center although they offer wireless internet in the rooms (so take your laptop). Every morning, they serve complimentary continental breakfast (includes bread, bagel, waffle, fresh fruit, cereal, juice, coffee). This was our first time to Seattle so we wanted to see everything. The location of the hotel is great. You can practically walk everywhere although you will be tired. Pike place market is 8 blocks down towards the water. The hotel offers a free shuttle in the downtown area which we used to drop us off at Pioneer square. We also found out that the buses in the downtown area are free and the last stop is 1 block from Summerfield Suites, right in front of the convention center. Parking - the hotel charges $20 for parking each night. We had a car but did not want to pay the fee so we parked on the street at night (free after 6pm and on Sundays). During the day, there is a parking lot on Pike, between 5th and 6th that offers $5 all day parking on the weekends. We paid a total of $5 for parking during our stay.On the second night, there were people who stayed a few doors down from our suite with dogs. You can hear them barking loudly until 11pm. After that, it stopped. If you have allergies to pets, you may want to confirm with the hotel that you get a room that have not have pets there before.All in all, we had a great stay at Summerfield suites and would stay here again the next time we are in Seattle.

Would stay at Summerfield again in a heartbeat I stayed here for one night by chance as I bid on a hotel through priceline. The location was perfect for me. You can walk a few minutes east and be in capitol hill or walk a few minutes west and be in the shopping district and eventually pike place market. So location is great. The room wasn't huge, but attractive and quiet. I had 2 full sized beds which would be crowded if you tried to fit 2 adults into each bed, but for me it was fine. The beds were very comfortable and didn't have gross  traditional hotel comfortors. The continental breakfast was great--hot and cold food, including waffle bar. Front desk staff was quiet and not very welcoming--the girl mumbled so much I had to ask her several times to repeat herself. But I figure I only have to deal with them for 3-4 minutes to check in and that doesn't really ruin the hotel experience. I used cabs so not sure about the parking costs or inconvenience. But again, great place, great location, and I plan to stay here again.

Clean and comfortable suites Our family of four stayed at the Summerfield Suites in Seattle for 4 nights in March. At first I was a bit nervous about staying here because of the recent poor reviews, but our stay was great and we had a wonderful mini holiday. Apparently the Summerfield Suites had been taken over by the Hyatt Group as of March 2006. I had reserved it through Priceline and had a great deal. When we checked in, we were given a standard room with 2 double beds. The room was clean and had a mini refrigerator. At check in, I was told that if I wanted to upgrade to a one bedroom suite, it would cost an additional $40. We decided to try the standard room first. While it would have been just fine for 2 of us, it was a bit cramped with 2 young children. The next day when I inquired about upgrading, the cost was quoted as only an additional $20 so we took advantage of it. The clean one bedroom suite was very spacious with a huge king bed in the bedroom, a pull out sofa in the living room, a full kitchen and a very large bathroom. It was very very comfortable for our family. Although this unit overlooked Pike Street and the I-5, the traffic noise did not bother us at all. The hotel's shuttle service was great . . . taking us to Pike Place Market, Science Center etc. The complimentary continental breakfast buffet was huge with many many choices. The staff, on the whole, was very professional and friendly. The location is great too . . .easy walking distance to shops and restaurants. The area felt safe to walk around at night with 2 young children.Our family wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Excellent as before We last stayed here in 2003, and I previously wrote a positive review. This time we had an even better experience, if that's possible. We once again booked through Priceline. We arrived for check-in around 11:15 PM. We had to wait for three other people to be checked in. When it was our turn, the clerk told us that he had automatically given us a late checkout of 2 PM so that we wouldn't have to rush in the morning. We were very happy for that, particularly getting it without asking. I didn't ask for any particular bedding arrangement, figuring we would just work with what we got. So imagine our delight to find we had two double beds in the bedroom, as well as the sofa hideabed (which didn't need to be used). The complimentary breakfast was pretty standard for a 2.5* hotel - I'd personally like less sugar and more whole-grain and protein options, but a reasonably healthy selection was available if you chose with care. As before, the suite had two TVs. I noticed that the TVs could not be raised to a very high volume. I remembered reading on another forum that some hotels had instituted this so that the noise would not disturb neighbors. That makes perfect sense, as with two TVs on in every suite at high volume, there could be quite a cacophony. I'm not one to be bothered by such things, but in my quest to be an objective reviewer, I did see a couple of chipped spots which would benefit from a spot of paint. All in all, this was a very nice, fully-equipped apartment, including full kitchen facilities.Note that as of January 5, 2006, Summerfield Suites is now a Hyatt brand, rather than Wyndham. The clerk explained to me that this was an improvement, because now you got free local calls and free Internet. I didn't use either, but I have to agree.

A Doggie Hotel, Not for People The smell and stains in hallways and in rooms tells everything.....this hotel caters to people with dogs. We checked into our room and the stench of dog with potent cleaning solution smell practically knocked us over. The staff was friendly and tried to accommodate, but they said there weren't any rooms that were designated for just people. So if you don't mind paying to stay in a room where dogs have obviously been, then Summerfield may be just the place for you.

bright, spacious, functional We had a wonderful stay here during our trip to Seattle. The staff were kind and courteous, allowed for early check-in (as we had come in from an early AM flight), and even gave us a room upgrade.The rooms were bright and spacious, and had a functional kitchenette.The location was in a safe area just off of downtown Seattle, and walking distance to the pier and nearly any points of interest in the city.Though this is not a glamorous hotel, no doubt, it meets and even exceeds everything that could be expected for needs of a business traveler or the practical tourist.

Great location. We stayed here one night and it was a very nice room. We had a balcony overlooking the Space Needle. Great downtown location and staff was extremely helpful. Free shuttle to nice restaurants overlooking Puget Sound. Would definately stay here again.

Would definitely stay here again We stayed here for 6 nights from July 31 to Aug 6, 2005. We chose this hotel primarily for the kitchenette which I needed to prepare meals for my 1 year-old. Our 1-bedroom suite in the corner was comfortable, bright, clean and the kitchenette was a great convenience. It sure beat having just a hotel room because the living room, bedroom and small balcony gave our little girl more room to explore and play and the place felt like a small apartment. The furniture was comfortable but the carpet needs replacing.Location-wise, we had no complaints. It's a straight shot down Pike Street to Pike Place market although the walk back is slightly uphil. Very close to all the shops and department stores.Staff were friendly and helpful though we did have a miscalculation in the parking charges but it was put right quite easily. We would definitely stay here again.

Worked Well for My Family, Enjoyed the Shuttle We spent some split time in Seattle (before and after a trip to Vancouver) and stayed here both times (total of four nights). The room was clean, as was the kitchenette. Kitchenettes are very handy with a picky three-year-old who's also vegetarian - plenty of leftovers to keep him happy! We took the shuttle operated by the hotel everywhere - to restaurants, attractions and microbreweries (one of THE places to get microbrewed beer is Seattle). The shuttle drivers were knowledgable and courteous, and made some minor deviations from their routes to help us get where we needed to go. Would stay there again.
A deal       the kitchen we didn't use
A home away from home       View from room towards Capitol Hill

Very Disappointing  I would like to describe what I can only describe as a thoroughly disappointing hotel experience. I made my reservations at this property months in advance based on several factors; Wyndham reputation, hotel location, services available (courtesy shuttle), and in room amenities. I was disappointed with all of these except the location. Upon check-in I was told the room I had reserved was not available. I had reserved a King suite and was given a suite with two double beds. I specifically reserved a King as I was traveling with an infant and knew that the extra space would be needed for the portable crib. I was told that the property was sold out, there was nothing they could do. Once I arrived at my room I was even more disappointed. The kitchen area was filthy. The dishes in the cupboard were dirty, the utensil drawers were full of mold and water, the bathroom had mold in the caulk, and my daughter (16 months old) found and was playing with an empty beer can in the back of a cabinet.
